Description:
SQL Database Administrator - Remote
Apply now Job no: 503673
Work type: Full Time Regular
Location: Remote
Categories: Information Technology
Be part of defining our company's future through the expansion of data and database services. The SQL Server Database Administrator plans for and provides reliable, available and secure infrastructure systems including effectively executing tactical planning and installation, configuration management, utilization, capacity management, vendor, and customer relationship management and problem resolution related to data infrastructure systems.
WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:
Estimated Salary: $110,000 - $120,000, plus annual bonus opportunity.
401(k) plan with a 2% company contribution and 6% company match.
Work-life balance with vacation, personal time and paid holidays. See our benefits and perks page for details.
Applicants for this position must not now, nor at any point in the future, require sponsorship for employment.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Install and maintain DBMS software including patches, fixes, database version upgrades and migrations to new database releases. Requires working closely with application support team partners to test, maintain schema objects, design & debug triggers, stored procedures and user defined functions.
Monitor the SQL Server DBMS environment, identify poorly performing jobs, assist with troubleshooting & tuning queries. Incident monitoring involves analysis of database logs, alerts for hardware, memory or disk capacity and performance issues to take appropriate actions. This will require implementing database parameter and configuration changes for optimal performance with the host operating system.
Availability, backup and recovery: Ensure data backup and recovery procedures are implemented with Business Resiliency procedures documented, reviewed and tested multiple times throughout the year.
User and data security: Design, implementation and maintenance of database security strategies that provide the appropriate level of privilege granted for users and applications.
Diagnose and troubleshoot complex database and application environments with imprecise information provided by customers and end users.
WHAT YOU'LL BRING:
5+ years of professional experience in SQL Server database administration using Windows operating systems including operating independently while supporting 24x7 production database systems within a team rotation.
Experience writing and maintaining SQL (structured query language) programming including queries, stored procedures, triggers, views, performance tuning.
Knowledge of database physical and logical design principles, while managing and deploying application database modifications.
Strong research capabilities: Experience identifying problems, effectively triaging and managing problems, prioritizing critical issues, and working with vendors as needed. Propensity for on-going process improvement.
Ability to clearly communicate complex technical problems to non-technical audiences, while working under pressure to quickly resolve critical production issues.
You promote a culture of diversity and inclusion, value different ideas and opinions, and listen courageously, remaining curious in all that you do.
Able to work remotely with access to a high-speed internet connection and located in the United States or Puerto Rico.
PREFERRED:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is highly preferred, or equivalent experience.
Experience with database monitoring/alerting tools such as ServiceNow, Patrol, Database Performance Suite (DBI).
Experience supporting Ansible/Ansible Tower development, and application development background.
We value diverse experience, skills, and passion for innovation. If your experience aligns with the listed requirements, please apply! 
If you have questions about your application or the hiring process, email our Talent Acquisition area at careers@mutualofomaha.com. Please allow at least one week from time of applying if you are checking on the status.

Description:
Senior Database Administrator (Lincoln, NE)

TELCOR Inc, a nationally recognized provider of healthcare software and billing service, is looking for an energetic, focused and motivated team member to join the database team!

This Senior Database is primarily responsible for Database Management, Data Maintenance, Database Performance Tuning, Database Security, Database replication, Promoting Process Improvement, Problem Solving, Presenting Technical Information, Attention to Detail, and Quality Focus. The Senior Database Administrator should be an expert in SQL Servers, proficient in Windows operating systems, VMware, SAN infrastructure as related to Database storage, as well as other Microsoft technology, including, but not limited to: Always-on and Hyper-V. The Senior Database Administrator should have experience with VLDBs and be comfortable working in a highly virtual environment. This position will also assist the RCM Development and RCM Services teams, as directed.

This position will require you to work in our office (Lincoln, NE) and teleworking is available at manager's discretion.

Requirements
Minimum of 3 years of database administration experience with MS SQL Database Server
Minimum of 3 years of Structured Query Language
Minimum of 3 years of experience supporting current versions of Windows
Advanced knowledge in designing, developing and implementing data warehouse and business intelligence solutions with MS SQL Server and Reporting Services (ETL, SSIS, Data warehousing, and OLAP Cubes)
Experience with reporting tools, such as Crystal Reports and Microsoft SQL reporting Services (SSRS) including stored procedures/functions
Strong knowledge of T-SQL and database programming
Strong knowledge of Windows and Networking required
Strong knowledge of VMware or Hyper-V
Excellent problem solving, logic, written and verbal communication skills required

Description:
WHY DIAMOND GAME?
When you work at Diamond Game you are part of a diverse, forward thinking, technology focused gaming organization. Diamond Game employees work alongside one another as part of an engaged team, making contributions at all levels to ensure the highest quality and standards.
As a Diamond Game employee, you are afforded growth opportunities, career mentoring and valuable work experience. Diamond Game appreciates and encourages growth within the organization, knowing it's our talent that keeps us moving forward.
Career development, a robust benefit package, work-life balance and an inclusive culture are all part of a complete and rewarding employee experience at Diamond Game.
Diamond Game designs, produces, and services electronic pull-tab games, gaming systems, and tickets for charitable gaming and lottery markets. Established in 1994, Diamond Game is proud to be a subsidiary of Pollard Banknote Limited and a sister company of Pollard Games, Inc DBA American Games and International Gamco.
Our mission is to develop and provide innovative gaming solutions to charitable gaming and lottery markets while providing players with thrilling gaming experiences. We always put customers first by providing consistent service and unique products that outperform our competitors. We foster a work environment for employees that encourages teamwork, imagination and continuous improvement. We are proud that our products positively impact many charitable communities across North America.
Our Core Values are: Collaboration; Innovation; Integrity; Growth; Play Fair; Be a Pro; and Have Fun!
 Position Summary
The Quality Assurance Assistant Manager takes direction from the QA/TS Manager and will work hands on with our engineering, product management, and marketing teams to test, deliver, and support gaming products in a manner that exceeds industry standards.
In this role the Assistant Manager will assist in quality assurance testing at all levels, including but not limited to test design, test execution, compliance testing, and paperwork. In addition, the Assistant Manager will be responsible for assisting with field support during business hours and as part of an on-call rotation, which will include creating and resolving tickets through email, phone calls, and on occasion site visits. The Assistant Manager will also be expected to assist with basic operation of the markets they are attached to. These responsibilities include but are not limited to game design planning, server maintenance, trade shows, and working with distributors to guarantee an ongoing healthy relationship.
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Assist the Quality Assurance Manager and field operations by managing and determining priorities.
Provide technical support to the team by architecting testing solutions, helping to resolve technical problems and challenges, and establishing testing standards.
Lead testing efforts for key large initiatives.
Directing the team in meeting critical deadlines and provide statuses to upper management.
Proactively engage with all levels of staff and provide positive and constructive input in project meetings and discussions with development and project management.
Be hands-on and thoroughly involved with all test preparation and planning to ensure deadlines and budgets are in line with annual department goals.
Maintain long term customers through contact daily.
Monitor daily reports on server health and security.
Reply to inquiries in a timely matter.
Install operating systems such as Ubuntu, Debian, and iPadOS.
Must be able and willing to travel (sometimes last minute) to customer locations, certification labs and other locations requiring support in the US and Canada (about 5%).
Consistently demonstrate the ability to practice Diamond Game's core values and apply
Perform other tasks and duties as needed and/or requested by management.
 Education & Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in technology related field or at least three year's relevant work experience.
Minimum of 1 year in a quality assurance role in software development and/or testing.
Minimum of 1 year working experience in software and hardware QA, the following systems are preferred: Debian, Ubuntu, and iPadOS.
Experience with various bug tracking software, writing test cases, test scripts and test plans.
Experience with test case management (Azure) software a plus.
Strong understanding of software QA methodologies and best practices (ISTQB).
Experience dealing with networking concepts and problems (routers, subnets, etc).
Experience working within web, desktop, service, embedded, and deployment applications.
Experience working in a front facing position, such as customer service or sales.
 Knowledge and Abilities Requirements
Possess knowledge of client/server and internet systems architectures.
Strong risk management skills and a knack for recognizing and anticipating things that would eventually turn into problems.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actions.
Working knowledge of SQL Databases.
Proficient in Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel and Outlook.
Proficient in Debian based Linux systems and be able to navigate using command line.
Thrives in fast paced environments.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to take instructions and work independently to complete the task.
 Compliance Requirements
Employment dependent on successfully passing a regulatory background and credit check.
This role will also require a background check with the Minnesota Gambling Control Board.
Employees may also be subject to additional periodic background checks as needed and/or required by Diamond Game and/or Diamond Game customers.
  Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision
401k with company match
Profit Sharing
Paid Vacation
Employee Referral Program
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program

 We thank all that apply; however only the most qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory response from a Background Screening (Criminal History Search and Drug Test).
Diamond Game Enterprises, a subsidiary of Pollard Banknote Limited provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
To ALL Recruitment Agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
 Company Description
Company Overview
Diamond Game designs, produces, and services games, gaming systems, and tickets for various North American Lotteries and alternative gaming markets. Established in 1994, Diamond Game is proud to be a subsidiary of Pollard Banknote Limited.

Our early success was as an innovative leader in the Class II Native American casino market. Since 2001 we have expanded into public gaming, commercial casino, VLT, race track, and bingo markets. Over the years, the Company has developed a reputation for being a provider of high quality gaming and lottery products and systems, and for having the only instant ticket dispenser with video approved as a Class II device by the U.S. Supreme Court.

Diamond Game creates innovative lottery products for public gaming and charity markets. Most notably, we created the patented Lucky Tab (LT-3) device, an instant ticket vending machine that dispenses tickets while simultaneously displaying the results of each ticket on a video monitor in an entertaining fashion. The ability to customize the LT-3 enables us to cater to varying market needs.

We also develop exciting alternative gaming products, such as Class II bingo and SkilTab, specific to the rules and statutes of various jurisdictions. At Diamond Game, we continuously develop new and thrilling games with state of the art technology that provide players with an entertaining gaming experience.

BinMaster Level Sensors Division

Technical Service Representative

Do you love to work with customers in a fast-paced environment? Do you consider yourself to be a techie? Do you like computers and working with software?Can you deal with customers on the phone and through chat? If you can answer yes to these questions, we may have the opportunity you are looking for!

If you are currently in one of the following roles you might be a great fit:

HVAC startup and installation
Cable/Satellite TV installation
PLC programing or commissioning
Instrumentation, sales, service, or manufacturing
Customer Service

ABOUT US:

We love a challenge and work hard to meet the needs of our diverse customer base with our commitment to the production of high-quality US-based parts.
Safety is one of our top priorities. Garner Industries is a credentialed SHARP participant and was recently presented with the Star Safety Award by the Nebraska Safety Council.
We were named Nebraska’s 2017 mid-sized manufacturer of the year by the Nebraska Chamber of Commerce & Industry.
In 2019, we were named manufacturer of the year by the Lincoln Chamber of Commerce.
We encourage you to live a healthy, vibrant life and were awarded the Governor's Excellence in Wellness Award in 2019.
Giving back to the community is something we love to do. Whether it's the United Way or our local Food Bank, part of our mission is helping those in need.

WHAT WE WILL ASK YOU TO DO:

Manage customer requests, questions, issues, and complaints on a variety of support channels (i.e., telephone, chat, email, video calls).
Provide customer technical support in product application, installation and use, including software application and setup.
Setup, configure, and troubleshoot accounts on our BinCloud software.
Be responsible for the execution of return and repair services of electronic and electromechanical equipment. Interface with sales, Customer Service and customers directly to provide resolution of equipment technical or repair issues.
Suggest, improve, and implement new processes and procedures to more efficiently execute activities above.

WHAT YOU SHOULD BRING TO THE TABLE:

Associates degree or equivalent work experience 5+ years in a technical field preferred.
Excellent communication skills.
Strong relationship talent with a focus on pleasing the customer.
Strong experience with computers, software applications, network architectures and MS product software.
Bilingual English-Spanish a plus.
Experience in the use of general test equipment.

DEMANDS OF THIS POSITION:

Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs., often while climbing a ladder.
Must be comfortable in industrial settings, including heights in and around large vessels and silos.
Must be willing and able to travel (including overnight stays). Travel is estimated at 5%.
Valid passport or the ability to obtain a passport.
Must possess and maintain a safe driving record and a valid State of Nebraska driver’s license.

WHAT WE BRING TO THE TABLE

Competitive wage based on education and experience.
Great emphasis on working safely.
Strong focus on celebrating success.
Employee focused environment.
Full health care benefits including dental and vision.
401k with company profit sharing.

Company Description
ProSidian is a Management and Operations Consulting Services Firm focusing on providing value to clients through tailored solutions based on industry leading practices.  ProSidian services focus on the broad spectrum of Risk Management, Compliance, Business Process, IT Effectiveness, Energy & Sustainability, and Talent Management.  We help forward thinking clients solve problems and improve operations. 
Launched by former Big 4 Management Consultants; our multidisciplinary teams bring together the talents of nearly 190 professionals globally to complete a wide variety of engagements for Private Companies, Fortune 1,000 Enterprises, and Government Agencies of all sizes.  Our Services are deployed across the enterprise, target drivers of economic profit (growth, margin and efficiency), and are aligned at the intersections of assets, processes, policies and people delivering value. 
ProSidian clients represent a broad spectrum of industries to include but are not limited to Energy, Manufacturing, Chemical, Retail, Healthcare, Telecommunications, Hospitality, Pharmaceuticals, Banking & Financial Services, Transportation, Federal and State Government Agencies.  Learn More About ProSidian Consulting at www.ProSidian.com.
Job Description
ProSidian Seeks a Data Base Administrator | Environmental Management [USACE030035] - DPLH Est.: 2080 Hrs. ST | 0 Hrs. OT on a Exempt Contract Contingent Basis Engagement Team | Full Stack Developer II or III IT108 Labor Category - STD Level Exempt Professional aligned under services related to NAICS: 541620 - DPLH Est.: 2080 Hrs. ST | 0 Hrs. OT on a Exempt Contract Contingent Basis located CONUS - Ten (10) States: Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Wyoming Across The Mid West Region supporting a federal agency within the Dept of Defense whose geo area encompasses a vast geographic region that includes all or parts of ten states: Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Wyoming to provide critical engineering services to strengthen national security, support economic growth, and mitigate disaster risks focusing on flood management, environmental restoration, and military construction across the Missouri River Basin.  The USACE NWO mission is to deliver vital engineering solutions, in collaboration with partners, to secure the nation, energize the economy, and reduce disaster risks by focusing on a diverse array of missions, including flood risk management, navigation, hydropower, environmental restoration, and regulatory oversight.
Seeking Data Base Administrator candidates with relevant Environmental Management Sector Experience (functional and technical area expertise also ideal) to support professional services engagement for Environmental Management Sector Clients such as USACE.  This as a Contract Contingent or Contract W-2 (IRS-1099) Position and ProSidian reserves the right to convert to a Full-Time ProSidian employed W-2 Position.
JOB OVERVIEW
Provide services and support as a Environmental Remediation Services (ERS) (Data Base Administrator) in the Environmental Management Industry Sector focusing on Environmental Services Solutions for clients such as Department of Defense (DoD - USACE) | U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Northwestern Division, Omaha District (USACE NWO) Area of Responsibility (AOR) Generally Located In CONUS - Ten (10) States: Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Wyoming and across the Mid West Region.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES - Data Base Administrator | Environmental Management [USACE030035]
Manage and maintain project databases; ensure data security; perform database updates.
Qualifications
Desired Qualifications For Data Base Administrator | Environmental Management [USACE030035] (USACE030035) Candidates:
Expertise in database management systems (e.g., SQL); experience in database administration.
Education / Experience Requirements / Qualifications
5+ years in database administration; certifications such as Microsoft Certified Database Administrator (MCDBA) are beneficial. | Bachelor's in Information Technology.
Skills Required
Skills Required: Database management, data security, technical troubleshooting, problem-solving. | Professional Licensure: MCDBA (Microsoft Certified Database Administrator) or equivalent recommended.
Competencies Required
Excellent oral and written communication skills (This employer participates in the e-Verify program).  Proficient with Microsoft Office Products (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, & Adobe)
Ancillary Details Of The Roles
Permits/Licenses:  Team ProSidian shall obtain permits and licenses necessary to conduct the work required by this contract, including, but not limited to, environmental permits, building permits, discharge permits, Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) or state licenses for radiation activities, and Department of Transportation (DOT) permits for transport of Munitions and Explosives of Concern (MEC) and Hazardous, Toxic and Radioactive Waste (HTRW) on public highways. - Standard Skills Required: Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools. | Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills for effective team management. | Outstanding time management and prioritization abilities to meet project milestones. | Adaptability to changing project requirements and priorities | Ability to multi-task and pay close attention to detail. | Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills | Strong communication skills, both oral and written.

We provide career opportunities spanning various disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build, and operate as diverse as the needs of our clients.

- Background Check And Drug testing: ProSidian reserves the right to require background checks, including criminal, employment, education, licensure, etc. as well as credit and motor vehicle when applicable for certain positions.  In addition, ProSidian may conduct drug testing for designated positions.
Other Details
Work products shall be thorough, accurate, appropriately documented, and comply with established criteria. All employees, in performing their respective responsibilities, shall conduct themselves in the highest possible standards of ethical and business conduct.  The candidate shall ensure that duties are performed in a competent and professional manner that meets milestones/delivery schedules as outlined.  Employees are subject to regulatory and mandatory training requirements. These requirements will change for individuals based on their job duties or position assignment.

CORE COMPETENCIES
Teamwork - ability to foster teamwork collaboratively as a participant, and effectively as a team leader
Leadership - ability to guide and lead colleagues on projects and initiatives
Business Acumen - understanding and insight into how organizations perform, including business processes, data, systems, and people
Communication - ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders of all levels orally and in writing
Motivation - persistent in pursuit of quality and optimal client and company solutions
Agility - ability to quickly understand and transition between different projects, concepts, initiatives, or work streams
Judgment - exercises prudence and insight in decision-making process while mindful of other stakeholders and long-term ramifications
Organization - ability to manage projects and activity, and prioritize tasks
----------- ------------ ------------
OTHER REQUIREMENTS
Business Tools -  understanding and proficiency with business tools and technology, including Microsoft Office. The ideal candidate is advanced with Excel, Access, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word, and proficient with Adobe Acrobat, data analytic tools, and Visio with the ability to quickly learn other tools as necessary.
Commitment - to work with smart, interesting people with diverse backgrounds to solve the biggest challenges across private, public and social sectors
Curiosity - the ideal candidate exhibits an inquisitive nature and the ability to question the status quo among a community of people they enjoy and teams that work well together
Humility - exhibits grace in success and failure while doing meaningful work where skills have impact and make a difference
Willingness - to constantly learn, share, and grow and to view the world as their classroom
------------ ------------ ------------
BENEFITS AND HIGHLIGHTS
ProSidian Employee Benefits and Highlights: Your good health and well-being are important to ProSidian Consulting. At ProSidian, we invest in our employees to help them stay healthy and achieve work-life balance. That's why we are also pleased to offer the Employee Benefits Program, designed to promote your health and personal welfare. Our growing list of benefits currently include the following for Full Time Employees:
Competitive Compensation: Pay range begins in the competitive ranges with Group Health Benefits, Pre-tax Employee Benefits, and Performance Incentives. For medical and dental benefits, the Company contributes a fixed dollar amount each month towards the plan you elect. Contributions are deducted on a Pre-tax basis.
Group Medical Health Insurance Benefits: ProSidian partners with BC/BS, to offer a range of medical plans, including high-deductible health plans or PPOs. ||| Group Dental Health Insurance Benefits: ProSidian dental carriers - Delta, Aetna, Guardian, and MetLife.
Group Vision Health Insurance Benefits: ProSidian offers high/low vision plans through 2 carriers: Aetna and VSP.
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan: 401(k) Retirement Savings Plans help you save for your retirement for eligible employees. A range of investment options are available with a personal financial planner to assist you. The Plan is a pre-tax Safe Harbor 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a company match.
Vacation and Paid Time-Off (PTO) Benefits: Eligible employees use PTO for vacation, a doctor's appointment, or any number of events in your life. Currently these benefits include Vacation/Sick days - 2 weeks/3 days | Holidays - 10 ProSidian and Government Days are given.
Pre-Tax Payment Programs: Pre-Tax Payment Programs currently exist in the form of a Premium Only Plan (POP). These Plans offer a full Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Plan and a tax benefit for eligible employees.
Purchasing Discounts & Savings Plans: We want you to achieve financial success. We offer a Purchasing Discounts & Savings Plan through The Corporate Perks Benefit Program. This provides special discounts for eligible employees on products and services you buy on a daily basis.
Security Clearance: Due to the nature of our consulting engagements there are Security Clearance requirements for Engagement Teams handling sensitive Engagements in the Federal Marketplace. A Security Clearance is a valued asset in your professional portfolio and adds to your credentials.
ProSidian Employee & Contractor Referral Bonus Program: ProSidian Consulting will pay up to 5k for all referrals employed for 90 days for candidates submitted through our Referral Program.
Performance Incentives: Due to the nature of our consulting engagements there are performance incentives associated with each new client that each employee works to pursue and support.
Flexible Spending Account: FSAs  help you pay for eligible out-of-pocket health care and dependent day care expenses on a pre-tax basis. You determine your projected expenses for the Plan Year and then elect to set aside a portion of each paycheck into your FSA.
Supplemental Life/Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance: If you want extra protection for yourself and your eligible dependents, you have the option to elect supplemental life insurance. D&D covers death or dismemberment from an accident only.
Short- and Long-Term Disability Insurance: Disability insurance plans are designed to provide income protection while you recover from a disability.

Job Description:
The Judicial Branch is a state-funded Branch of Government that offers medical/dental/vision, $20,000 free basic life insurance, state-matched 156% retirement plan, 13 paid holidays, earned paid vacation and sick leave, and more.

Under limited supervision, manages the activities and operations required to maintain the Nebraska Judicial Branch's servers and associated storage environments, and various other systems in support of the Branch's data infrastructure. Responsibilities include managing statewide activities and operations required to create and maintain the Nebraska Judicial Branch data systems infrastructure. This includes overseeing system administration, system cybersecurity program architecture, configuration, and maintenance; monitoring system performance; providing technical resolutions for complex system issues; training staff; and providing systems architecture and policy recommendations to senior management.

JOB DUTIES

1. Design and implement long-term strategic goals and short-term tactical plans for managing and maintaining the Judicial Department's systems and software.

2. Responsible for planning, architecture/design, and implementation of hardware and software installations, configurations, and decommissions.

3. Responsible for monitoring and maintenance of relevant systems and associated hardware/software and provides support and troubleshooting for those systems when required.

4. Responsible for maintaining and monitoring the secure configuration and operations of all in-place devices to include security tools, workstations, mobile devices, servers and network devices.

5. Assists the Information Security Officer in the design and execution of system vulnerability assessments, system penetration tests, and system security audit.

6. Performs other duties of a similar nature or level.

FUNCTIONAL SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES MIGHT INCLUDE
Manages enterprise IT systems and cloud infrastructure, which includes maintenance, testing, system backups, restoring the system after a failure, configuring and maintaining on-prem and cloud systems, creating and maintaining system scripts, installing system software, understanding connections to other computer systems, and answering questions and providing assistance as needed.
Develops and implements strategies for server management including monitoring performance, preventative maintenance, problem avoidance, and troubleshooting.
Designs, installs, monitors, and maintains system security, which includes implementing security practices, configuring equipment, diagnosing and resolving connectivity issues, and ensuring system security standards are enforced.
Establishes, implements, and maintains system security strategy and requirements.

Description:
**If you are a current FIB employee, please apply through the Career Worklet in the Employee Portal.
This position may be located at any of the offices within First Interstate Bank's fourteen state footprint, including Arizona, Colorado, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oregon, South Dakota, Washington and Wyoming.
What's Important to You
We know your career is just one aspect of a meaningful, complex, and demanding life. That's why we designed our compensation and benefits package to provide employees and their families with as much choice as possible.
Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) in addition to paid federal holidays.
Student debt employer repayment program.
401(k) retirement plan with a 6% match.
The health and happiness of the places we call home matter to us. Learn a little more about what we do for the communities we serve, and why we want YOU to be a part of it.
We encourage you to apply. Reach for what you want and tell us why your work ethic and willingness to learn make you a natural fit for #TeamFirstInterstate.
SUMMARY
As the IT Operations Management (ITOM) and Configuration Management Database (CMDB) Administrator, you will oversee our ServiceNow ITOM and CMDB, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and consistency. You will possess a deep understanding of CMDB best practices and collaborate effectively with IT teams to maintain the completeness and reliability of our CMDB. You will help develop and maintain the technical design of the ServiceNow CMDB to meet the current and anticipated scope, maintain CMDB integrity, and effectively support other IT Service Management (ITSM) processes such as Event, Incident, Change, and Asset Management. Your role will be crucial in aligning our CMDB to ITSM core processes to successfully achieve organizational goals.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure all Configuration Items (CIs) such as hardware, software, network, communications, and data, are actively recorded and positively managed.
Develop, implement, and maintain configuration management processes and standards.
Manage the Configuration Management Plan and its implementation.
Support periodic reviews of configuration management processes and standards to ensure they align with best practices.
Identify and implement improvements to CMDB processes and tools to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Generate and present regular reports on CMDB status, metrics, and improvement initiatives to senior management.
Ensure the accuracy and consistency of data within the CMDB.
Configure and manage Discovery schedules.
Configure and Manage CMDB Health Dashboard and CI Health and Hygiene Tasks.
Integrate with third party applications to bring Asset Data into CMDB.
Develop and implement performance metrics, KPIs, and reporting tools to monitor the effectiveness of ITOM and CMDB processes and identify areas for improvement.
Conduct training sessions and workshops for IT teams to ensure effective adoption of ITOM and CMDB functionalities within ServiceNow.
Stay up-to-date with the latest ServiceNow ITOM and CMDB features, updates, and industry trends to provide informed recommendations for continuous improvement.

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Strong communication skills, both written and oral.
Ability to remain objective and professional in times of conflict.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Must be a self-starter; Ability to work independently or with a team.
Ability to properly prioritize workload and remain adaptable under pressure.
Must have strong organizational and analytical skills.
Must possess a solid balance of technical and business knowledge.
Must possess skill mastery and aptitude to easily take on new applications.

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent work experience) required.
ServiceNow certifications (e.g., Certified System Administrator, Certified Application Developer, Certified Implementation Specialist) are a plus.
ITIL Foundation preferred.
WORK EXPERIENCE
4-6 years proven experience in configuration management, CMDB administration, ITOM or related IT service management roles required.
1-3 years experience with ITIL processes and best practices preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING ENVIRONMENT
The physical demands and work environment are representative of those that must be met or encountered to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, the company provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.
Dexterity of hands/fingers to operate computer keyboard and mouse - Frequently
Sitting - Frequently
Standing - Occasionally
Noise Level - Moderate
Lifting up to 50lbs - Occasionally
Typical Work hours - M-F (8-5)
Regular and Predictable Attendance - Required
Overtime - Subject to business need
Weekends Required - Subject to business need
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
We offer a competitive total compensation package including base salary and benefits. The anticipated pay range for this position is $78,540 to $125,730 per year (in CO & WA), $71,400 to $114,300 per year in MN and depends on a variety of non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, job-related knowledge, skills and experience, education, and geographic location. Additionally, this role is eligible to receive annual discretionary cash bonuses. Benefits available for this position include, but are not limited to, medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability benefits and life insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, employee assistance program, 401(k), Paid Time Off (new hires accrue at .088 per hours worked which equates to approximately 23 days per year inclusive of paid sick time) and up to 11 paid Federal holidays. Please note this information is provided for those hired in Minnesota, Colorado and Washington only, and this role is open to candidates outside of Minnesota, Colorado and Washington with compensation that aligns with your location. For more information regarding our benefits, please visit https://www.firstinterstatebank.com/company/about/employee-benefits.php.

About AlffCo:

Founded in 1996, AlffCo is a leading facility and property maintenance provider. We deliver a wide range of services across the commercial facility maintenance industry, including Landscaping, Parking Lot Services, Power-Washing, Snow Removal, Electrical, Plumbing, HVAC, Refrigeration, and more.
Our commitment to quality and attention to detail allows our nationwide clients to focus on growing their businesses, while we handle the continuous needs of their properties. At AlffCo, we treat our clients’ properties as if they were our own, maintaining a standard of excellence unmatched by our competitors.
As a Salesforce Administrator, you will be responsible for the administration, support, and maintenance of the Salesforce platform within the organization. Applicants should have and be comfortable doing basic Salesforce administration tasks such as user management, configuration, and building reports/dashboards. Additionally, this role will involve troubleshooting issues, growing your skills with experienced team members, and promoting the functionality of Salesforce with other internal systems. The Salesforce Administrator plays a crucial role in optimizing Salesforce usage to enhance organizational efficiency and productivity.

Key Responsibilities:
All aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups
Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, fields, page layouts, record types, custom settings, dashboards, and reports.
Maintaining of Salesforce sharing and security (roles, profiles, permissions, OWD, sharing rules)
Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules, accurate data exports, and automation as needed.
User support tickets
Training users on new processes, providing refresher courses as needed, and creating training materials.
Create and customize reports to meet organizational requirements and support decision-making processes.
Actively engage in learning from experienced team members, adapt to new technologies, and contribute to collaborative efforts.
Be on-call for weekend support, addressing any urgent issues that may arise.
Other Responsibilities
Perform additional duties as assigned.
Adhering to AlffCo values and professionalism.
Weekends/nights may be required
Requirements:

Technical Proficiency:
Bachelor’s degree in technology or business. Experience will offset education.
1-3 years of Salesforce experience.
Certified Salesforce Administrator.
Familiar with admin tools like Salesforce Inspector, Salesforce Navigator, or Field Trip.
Familiarity with JSON, integrations, and troubleshooting issues to effectively resolve incoming tickets.
Proficient in debugging Apex code to address issues within the Salesforce environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, SharePoint, Teams) or similar software.
Quick learning ability for new database programs and proficient navigation of communication tools.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and identify, analyze, and solve problems proactively.
Problem-Solving and Independence:
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and identify, analyze, and solve problems proactively.
Communication and Interpersonal Skills:
Ability to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization.
Professionalism and Adaptability:
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines while maintaining a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.
Ability to work in an office setting; this is not a remote position.
Desired Qualifications:
Basic understanding of facility management, construction, or related industries is advantageous.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to tasks and challenges.
Strong customer service orientation with a collaborative and approachable demeanor.
Demonstrated ability to adapt to evolving work environments and responsibilities.
Benefits:

At AlffCo, we strive to provide you with a comprehensive and valuable benefits package as an important part of your overall compensation. Our affordable and competitive benefits include:
Medical, dental, and vision insurance.
Life and disability insurance (short and long-term).
Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
Health Savings Account (HSA).
Flexible Spending Accounts - Health Care and Dependent Care.
401(k) Plan.
DTO & PTO & Holiday Pay.
Why Join AlffCo?

At AlffCo, we value leadership, innovation, and attention to detail. As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a company that cares about its clients and employees while enjoying the freedom to grow professionally in a dynamic and supportive environment.

Real Time Systems Administrator / Developer to fill the position of Technical or Systems Analyst
Salary Range
Technical Analyst - $6,288.00 - $7,860.00 monthly
Systems Analyst - $7,979.00 - $10,173.00 monthly
Location - Brownville, NE Cooper Nuclear Station 
Employment Type: Full-time
Posting Date: 1/22/2025
Closing Date:  Applicant review will begin on February 5, 2025, and this position will remain open until filled.
  Nebraska Public Power District is hiring! Join our team as a Real Time Systems Administrator / Developer and become an important part of our NPPD story. We are proud of our history, powering every corner of Nebraska, every day, for half a century. We recognize that it takes a diverse group of individuals to move forward in the rapidly changing energy industry, and now is the time to power our own transformation. Come with us on our journey, walking alongside teammates and our customers, leading the way in providing safe, reliable, sustainable energy for all Nebraskans, all while protecting our environment, powering our lives, and realizing our dreams. That's NPPD...the Power of People.
 Get to know us more here.
   Position Summary
  We are looking for a talented and motivated Real-Time Systems Administrator/Developer excited about ensuring the reliability, security, and efficiency of NPPD real-time computer systems.
  The ideal candidate will have the skills and expertise to deploy, configure, maintain, and monitor computer systems software and hardware, ensuring seamless operations. Responsibilities include troubleshooting and resolving issues, implementing security measures, setting up accounts and workstations, and monitoring performance according to requirements.
  This position will play a crucial role in maintaining the robust and dependable real-time computer systems used by the District.
Education, Training and Experience
  Technical Analyst:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (OR)  Associate degree and a minimum of three (3) years technical IT experience, including specific experience as listed below (OR) High school diploma/GED and a minimum of five (5) years technical IT experience, including specific experience as listed below.
  Systems Analyst:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field and a minimum of four (4) years technical IT experience as listed below (OR)  Associate degree and a minimum of six (6) years technical IT experience including specific experience as listed below (OR) a high school diploma/GED and a minimum of eight (8) years technical IT experience including specific experience as listed below.
  Experience
  Ability to work independently and in cooperation with others on multiple activities with flexibility to manage competing demands and changing priorities.
  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organization skills.
  Excellent analytical problem-solving skills.
  Must be customer-service oriented and adaptable to ongoing change.
Ideal Technical Skills
Software integrated real-time industrial control systems experience
Full stack Application Development or Application Development experience
SQL database development experience
Familiarity with TCP-IP network troubleshooting
Network administration experience
Licenses and/or Certifications
  Security Clearance: Incumbent may be required to satisfy any existing and future District security clearance or background check requirements for access to key NPPD locations and/or supporting sensitive business applications.
  Obtain and maintain intermediate to advanced technical certification aligned with key business system platform(s) used at the District (for example, SAP, Microsoft Certifications, and Security related best practices) as applicable.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
  Technical Analyst:
  Analyze, design, develop, configure, maintain, troubleshoot, and provide direction and support for complex systems, applications and databases in support of the District's computing environment. Provide technical architecture recommendations and apply best practices in system design, development, and testing. Collaborate with/advise/coach other ET/Corporate Security and business unit analysts to ensure understanding of business and technical work processes, tools, and best practices.
  Evaluate, create, document, and test complex system-related interfaces and integration.
  Maintains efficient and effective management of vendor contract service relationships pertaining to technical services.
  Provide 24/7 system support, carry a mobile communications device, and perform duties from remote locations such as home and during business travel.
    Systems Analyst:
  In addition to being proficient in all duties of the Technical Analyst, the Systems Analyst will also be responsible for the following duties:
  Lead special task groups, trouble-shooting efforts, and integration and/or improvement project teams.
  Lead the development and implementation of training and communications plans/materials.
Accountable for other duties as assigned.
Core Competencies
Customer Focus
Employees & Teamwork/Diversity & Inclusion
Integrity/Excellence
Public Service/Environmental Stewardship
Safety

PURPOSE OF POSITION:
The Office Administrator will be responsible for executing administrative tasks required for the operations of the organization. This role requires a highly organized, detail-oriented individual with excellent communication skills. An emphasis on documenting and following well-considered policies and procedures is critical. The position must be committed to supporting staff and solve problems with a customer-service mentality.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Serve as the point of contact with vendors (i.e., Human Resources support, technology services, A/V, copy & print, etc.) for service and maintenance issues. Review monthly invoices and paid subscription licenses.
2. Handle inquiries from employees on operations related issues including IT, human resources, and facilities to either resolve or escalate to internal leadership or outsourced resources.
3. Coordinate with vendors for all employee trainings including but not limited to information security, hardware, software, and harassment prevention.
4. Execute human resources activities including job postings, coordinating with hiring managers, onboarding, and offboarding.
5. Develop and maintain filing system (paper and electronic) for HR records, policies, and employee development plans.
6. Maintain inventory of IT equipment (e.g., laptops, iPads, monitors, accessories), deploy equipment to newly hired employees, and handle equipment requests from employees.
7. Assist in planning and executing both in-house or off-site employee-related events.
8. Provide support for Leadership Development programs and activities.
9. Assist in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports.
10. Implement and maintain office procedures and policies.
OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Attend/work a variety of Chamber events and represent the organization as needed at business and community programs/events.
2. Maintain ongoing relationships with member companies as potential vendors.
3. Represent the Chamber with professionalism and integrity.
4. Actively participate in diversity, equity, and inclusion training in order to advance along one’s own journey of inclusion and acceptance.
5. Other duties as assigned.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
None.
FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY:
Expenditures require approval of senior management. Responsible for oversight of outsourced service contracts including review of invoices for accuracy. Supports SVP of Operations in development of operations budget.
QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. The requirements listed should be representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Education and related work experience
1. Associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred; and three years of proven experience as an office manager, administrative assistant, or related operations role.
Certifications, Licenses, Designations
Valid Driver’s License
Other Skills and Qualifications
1. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours, include evenings, early mornings and weekends.
2. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
3. Experience working with and overseeing multiple vendors and contractors.
4. Strong time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work.
5. Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
6. Ability to effectively collaborate with a diverse group of partners and stakeholders.
7. Strong written, verbal communication and customer service skills.
8. Must be a team player an self-starter capable of working with limited supervision.
9. Ability to drive and/or provide own transportation to various locations around the city on a regular basis.
Physical Demands
1. Typical office environment.
2. Requires long periods of sitting in meetings and standing at Chamber functions.

Your career at INNOVIM enables NISSC to fulfill its mission to “provide classified communications and processing for Command and Control (C2) capability in organizational work centers at NISSC sites.” As a member of our team, you will support corporate and customer missions to provide world-class IT services and support that connects systems and users across NORAD in the areas of software development/maintenance, network services, cyber security, systems administration, and other mission-critical areas.

skills.

and system interfaces for computer systems.

Office Administrator (OA) Job Summary

Description:
DEPARTMENT: Finishing
LOCATION: International Gamco (9335 N 48th St. Omaha, NE)
SCHEDULE: Monday - Thursday (3:45 PM - 2:15 AM)
PAY RANGE: $20 + Based on Experience
What You'll Do
The 2-Way Machine Operator position is a full-time, permanent role within a manufacturing environment, specializing in the production of charitable and lottery gaming products, including pull-tab (break-open) tickets. The 2-Way Machine Operator is responsible for the precise cutting, finishing, and quality control of tickets while operating and maintaining specialized printing and finishing equipment. This role requires a strong background in machine operation, production workflows and print manufacturing to ensure efficiency, accuracy, and adherence to quality standards.
The ideal candidate will possess 3 to 5 years of experience in a crew-based manufacturing setting, with expertise in machine operations, bindery, printing, feeder operation and finishing processes.
Additional Duties and Responsibilities Include:
Operate and maintain 2-Way Machines, ensuring proper setup, operation and quality control throughout the production process.
Set up and calibrate equipment per game documentation, job specifications and work schedules.
Monitor machine performance and troubleshoot issues to minimize downtime and ensure production efficiency.
Inspect product quality by conducting regular checks on output, ensuring compliance with specifications, and making real-time adjustments as needed.
Work closely with other departments to optimize production efficiency and meet deadlines.
Review and interpret production schedules, game documentation and job instructions to ensure accurate execution.
Ensure correct labeling and documentation in accordance with company procedures and quality standards.
Perform routine maintenance on machinery to prevent breakdowns and maximize operational efficiency.
Train and lead feeder operators and other crew members, fostering teamwork and knowledge-sharing.
Follow all safety policies, guidelines and procedures, ensuring a safe work environment.
Ensure proper material handling and organization, reducing waste and improving workflow.
Contribute to process improvements, recommending ways to optimize production, reduce costs, and enhance quality.
Assist in reviewing upcoming jobs and collaborate with leadership on optimizing production strategies.
Other duties as assigned.
What You'll Need
High School Diploma or GED.
2 to 4 years of technical training or experience in machine operation, printing or related fields.
3 to 5 years of experience in manufacturing, specifically in machine operation, feeder operation, print production or bindery.
Experience with die-cutting and web press printing a plus.
Comprehensive computer experience, including proficiency in operating machine interfaces and tracking and analyzing production data.
Strong mechanical aptitude with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve machine issues.
Ability to lead and train a team, ensuring smooth production flow.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, for reporting and team coordination.
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in production processes.
Ability to analyze and improve processes, identifying ways to enhance efficiency and quality.
Ability to work well in a diverse environment.
External candidates must be a US Citizen/Permanent Resident.
TOTAL REWARDS
Competitive Salary | Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance Benefits | Employee Assistance Program | Tuition Reimbursement | Generous Paid Time Off | 401k with Company Match | Profit Sharing | Unlimited Referral Bonus Earning Potential | And More!

Description
System Administrator
Are you passionate about making a meaningful impact in EMS? Join MMT Ambulance and make a Real Difference!    Are you excited about data and creating meaningful connections that drive important decisions? Can you draw insights from data to identify patterns and trends of significance? The right approach can help leaders drive meaningful change in their organizations. We are looking for you, a System Administrator who will use equal parts skill and vision to build an experience that delivers functionality and efficiency. We need a self-starter who is on top of emerging trends in technology with innovative ideas and vision. This is an opportunity to increase and enhance systems used at MMT by collaborating with others and finding new ways to continue improvement.  Experience in Emergency Medical Services is a plus but is not required. This position is open to remote work anywhere within the U.S. And some travel may be required.
 We prioritize our team members by offering cutting-edge technology, updated vehicles, and fostering a supportive company culture. Join us and enjoy competitive pay, flexible scheduling, excellent benefits, free continuing education, recognition rewards, and more.          
Qualifications
System Administrator position Duties and responsibilities:
Technical Skills
Network Management: Ensuring reliable and secure network connectivity for communication systems. Fortinet experience is a plus.
Database Management: Basic SQL scripting and knowledge.
Basic Programming: Sometimes using things like PowerShell or similar languages if needed to script tasks.
Cybersecurity: Utilizing software and services to protect sensitive patient and operational data from cyber threats.
System Integration: Integrating various software and hardware systems used in ambulance services.
Disaster Recovery: Implementing and managing backup and recovery solutions to ensure data integrity.
Soft Skills
Problem-Solving: Quickly diagnosing and resolving technical issues.
Logical Thinking: Finding ways to allow multiple different systems to communicate with each other.
Communication: Effectively communicating with medical staff, dispatchers, and other stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy in system configurations and data management.
Project Management: Overseeing IT projects, such as system upgrades or new software implementations.
Required Education and Experience
Knowledge of Medical Software: Familiarity with Electronic Patient Care Records (EPCR) and other medical software.
Compliance: Understanding and ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations like HIPAA.
Computer Aided Dispatch Systems: Managing systems that support response and dispatch operations.
Vehicle Telemetry: Monitoring and maintaining systems that track ambulance locations and statuses.
Competencies 
Self-confidence, emotional stability, and good judgment
Possess good verbal communication skills 
Ability to handle adverse situations effectively 
Who We Are 
 For over 35 years, MMT has been at the forefront of innovation, continuously expanding to support our team members and provide efficient, reliable interfacility ambulance patient transportation for our healthcare partners. Our growth is fueled by our experienced, empowered, and dedicated workforce, delivering exceptional care to patients. 
MMT employs AI-powered technology and state-of-the-art dispatch centers to ensure on-time, efficient, and effective operations. With a growing fleet of 500+ vehicles and a workforce of roughly 1,600 providers, MMT is committed to delivering the best patient care 24/7/365. 
If you are ready to contribute to our mission of delivering exceptional patient care, apply today to be a part of the MMT Ambulance team! 
Statement of Equal Opportunity Employment  
 It is the policy of MMT Ambulance to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identify, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital status, status as a veteran military service, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local civil rights laws.

Job Description

Position : System Administrator

Location : Omaha NE

Duration : Full time .Immediate interview

Minimum Requirement

Experience in windows and Linux servers administration .

Having cloud experience in Added plus.

Primary Function: The Systems Administrator's role is to administer and optimize systems and servers related components to achieve high performance of the various business applications in managed cloud environment. This includes ensuring the availability of client/server applications, configuring all new implementations, and developing processes and procedures for ongoing management of both a Linux and a Microsoft topology.

Essential Functions: (95%)

Develop strategies for client/server implementations; architect the infrastructure required to support those strategies.
Act as project lead in the design and review of new server systems, applications, and hardware; conduct capacity planning as needed.
Lead, coordinate and participate in key process improvements as they relate to cloud environment and architecture.
Coordinate and collaborate with network engineering, business application, and database administration function to ensure availability, reliability, and scalability.
Establish and implement policies, procedures, and technologies to ensure server security.
Develops and implements procedures for all aspects of server asset management, including routine maintenance, change control, and OS or application updates.
Maintains the service catalog and documentation for all services defined.
Keeps current all control logs documentation and standard operating procedure documentation.
Establishes service level agreements with end users for all services offered including connectivity and uptime services.
Performs server design and capacity planning.
Perform file system configuration and management; define and perform server backups and recovery procedures.
Plan and implement server upgrades, maintenance fixes, and vendor-supplied patches.
Provide Web administration support by overseeing and maintaining Web server functions, such as assuring logging and metrics data are stable.
Monitor and test system performance and provide performance statistics and reports.
Create shell scripts as required.
Manage enterprise directory services and supporting server infrastructure.
Define and implement strategies for integrating disparate operating environments.
Recommend and execute modifications to server environment in order to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance.
Develop and maintain training materials and server documentation.
Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team.
Manages changes to production systems to ensure proper change controls and procedure and documentation updates are completed.
Keeps apprised of developments in field of expertise to ensure currency and makes recommendations to senior management to improve process.


Marginal Functions: (5%)
Performs other duties as requested.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or related discipline required (equivalent years of related work experience may be substituted in lieu of degree).
Minimum five years' equivalent work experience in a senior technical analytical position responsible for managing server environments.
Experience with cloud migration and working within a managed cloud environment is a must. AWS government cloud experience is preferred not required.
Advanced knowledge of Active Directory 2008, MS SQL, MS IIS and MS Server 2008/2012, Red Hat Enterprise Linux and Apache Tomcat.
Exceptional abilities at load balancing, elastic load balancing, clustering, auto scaling and caching procedures and processes.
Specific knowledge of Windows Server 2008-2012 R2, platform(s) required, as well as strong working knowledge of SQL and PostgreSQL relational database(s).
Specific experience with DNS, WINS, DHCP, Radius, Microsoft SQL, and VMware
Experience with server performance tuning and monitoring tools.
Familiarity with TCP/IP and LAN/WAN network protocols, Cisco ASA firewall management, and operating system configuration.
General knowledge of storage technologies such as SAN or NAS.
Proven knowledge of systems development life cycle methodologies.
Detail orientated with strong analytical and problem solving skills required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, required.
Demonstrated experience with interacting and working effectively with internal and external constituents to provide the highest quality of customer service.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects/tasks simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment, while producing optimal outcomes.
Flexibility and the ability to operate under stressful, time-sensitive deadlines.
Ability to work both independently and in a collaborative team environment.
Must be able to maintain a high degree of confidentiality.


Working Conditions:

On-call availability for 7 days on a rotating schedule.
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate power tools, computer keyboard, mouse, and to handle other computer components.


NOTE: The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this job. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.

Description:
Job Summary:

In this role, you will be responsible for the installation, configuration, maintenance, and support of the company's IT infrastructure. You will ensure the availability, security, and performance of critical systems and services. While experience with Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI), particularly Omnissa (VMware) Horizon, is not required, it is preferred. The ideal candidate will also have expertise in network administration, server management, and security best practices, with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Functions & Job Responsibilities:
System Setup & Maintenance:
Install, configure, and maintain physical and virtual servers, operating systems (Windows, Linux, etc.), and network devices.
Ensure continuous system uptime and performance by performing regular maintenance, updates, and patches.
Network Administration:
Manage and maintain local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), and other related systems.
Configure firewalls, routers, switches, and other network devices to ensure optimal performance and security.
User Support & Troubleshooting:
Provide technical support for system users, resolving issues related to software, hardware, and network connectivity.
Assist in the installation and configuration of software and applications.
Security Management:
Monitor and ensure system security through routine audits, firewalls, antivirus software, and other security measures.
Perform regular backups, disaster recovery, and manage data security protocols.
Performance Monitoring & Reporting:
Monitor system performance, network traffic, and storage resources to ensure efficiency.
Provide regular reports on system health, incidents, and upgrades.
Documentation & Compliance:
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for network and system configurations, policies, procedures, and changes.
Ensure that all systems comply with relevant industry standards and internal policies.
Collaboration & Coordination:
Work closely with other IT professionals and teams to integrate, troubleshoot, and enhance systems and services.
Participate in IT projects and recommend improvements for system architecture.
VDI Management (Preferred):
If applicable, assist with the administration and troubleshooting of Omnissa (VMware) Horizon or other VDI environments.
Help optimize VDI performance and manage resources for virtual desktop solutions.


Required Skills & Abilities:
Technical Skills:
Proficient in operating systems (Windows Server, Linux, Unix).
Knowledge of virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V).
Strong understanding of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with scripting and automation tools (PowerShell, Bash, etc.).
Experience with Omnissa (VMware) Horizon or other VDI solutions is a plus, but not required.
Certifications (optional, but preferred):
CompTIA Network+
Microsoft Certified: Windows Server, Azure
VMware Certified Professional (VCP)
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with non-technical staff.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Education, Experience and Pay:
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Experience:
3+ years of experience in system administration, network management, or IT support.
Proven experience with server management (Windows, Linux), databases, and network configuration.
Pay is commensurate to education and experience within similar roles. It can range from $54,500-$100,000.


Physical Demands & Work Environment:
Full-time position based at our office locations; remote work is not available.
Occasional travel may be required to remote offices or data centers.
Stand and walk for up to 10 hours per day.
Use hand and fingers to type and conduct computer tasks for up to 8 hours per day.
Ability to work in a dusty, hot environment for up to 10 hours per day.
Ability to work on-call or outside regular hours for system maintenance or troubleshooting when necessary.

The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 180 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 300 pounds with assistance from others. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
   Working Environment:
Due to the nature of EMS Care working conditions, employees may be exposed to inclement weather, potential hazardous conditions, psychological stressors, diseases and other illnesses. Frequent interruptions, work pressure, difficult personalities and irregularities in work schedule are expected. Employee is subject to continually changing deadlines, while performing the duties of this job. The employee will be occasionally required to attend meetings, some of which may take place outside of regular working hours.

Your dedication and expertise will be invaluable in our mission to provide exceptional care to those in need.

Job Overview:
BrightStar Care of Omaha is hiring full and part time positions! We have morning and evening shifts available. Our mission is to go above and beyond to truly deliver a Higher Standard of Care and nothing less. It is more than just our work, helping people is our passion. It is what makes us truly shine - knowing that we are making a real difference by bringing more to the lives of others every day. We are looking for dynamic team members to join our organization and be a part of BrightStar's mission. You will be a part of a professional, forward-thinking, and experienced team positioned for career growth and development.
We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated Nursing Assistant to join our Home Healthcare team. As a Nursing Assistant, you will provide essential care and support to patients in their homes in the Omaha Metro area. This is a rewarding opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals in need of medical assistance.
Responsibilities:
- Assist patients with activities of daily living, including bathing, dressing, and grooming
- Monitor and record vital signs, such as blood pressure, temperature, and pulse
- Administer medications under the supervision of a registered nurse
- Perform basic medical procedures, such as venipuncture and catheterization
- Assist with patient assessments and document observations
- Provide specialized care for patients with specific needs, such as pediatrics or memory care
- Support patients with dementia by providing emotional support and engaging in therapeutic activities
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals to develop and implement patient care plans
- Maintain a clean and safe environment for patients
Requirements:
- Valid certification as a Nursing Assistant
- Knowledge of medical terminology and procedures
- Experience working in a nursing home or similar healthcare setting is preferred
- Strong communication skills to effectively interact with patients, families, and healthcare team members
- Compassionate and empathetic nature towards patients in need of care
- Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail
We offer competitive pay rates (Paid Weekly!!) and opportunities for career growth within our organization. Join our team of dedicated healthcare professionals and make a difference in the lives of those we serve.

Our process is designed to be transparent, fair, and non-discriminatory, ensuring privacy and providing candidates the opportunity to discuss any findings. Description:
biBerk is building a cloud-first, API driven, dynamic insurance platform that enables customers to purchase insurance policies directly online. Expanding our team, we are adding experienced software innovators to enhance our development efforts.

This role combines technical expertise with leadership skills. The Team Lead for Database Services position will lead a team of database administrators and database developers, help coordinate the day-to-day activities of various team members, assist the team with roadblocks, and lead planning sessions. This team lead will work closely with other development and technology teams to support their efforts and ensure biBerk's database systems are performing properly. They will also serve as an individual contributor on the database team, taking on tasks for both technical design and development.

Job Responsibilities
Manage the database team including managing sprint obligations and mentoring junior team members
Serve as technical SME for database services
Design database systems to meet business objectives while fitting into the enterprise platform ecosystem
Contribute to cross-team platform design decisions
Collaborate with the Product team to ensure that requirements are understood, and short-term and long-term business objectives are met
Follow department-wide technical, process, and quality standards while contributing to their improvement
Participate in staffing decisions including interviews and hiring
Take a lead role in creating technical documentation and content, ensuring that knowledge is transferred across the team
Ensure that the team achieves system performance goals
Lead the database team to think with a security first mindset
Take ownership of problems and solutions, being proactive to ensure success
Provide innovative problem-solving skills, thinking outside the box
Occasional travel to Wilkes-Barre/Scranton PA area for strategy meetings (several times per year)
Design and manage Microsoft SQL server infrastructure
Design and manage Azure SQL server infrastructure
Design and manage Azure Cosmos database infrastructure
Design and manage Azure Data Factory
Design and write scripts to transform or fix data as necessary in SQL and Cosmos


Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Related field or equivalent working experience
10+ Years of proven experience in a database administrator/database engineer/database developer or similar role, preferably a role that combined both administration and developer tasks, with at least 3 years in a leadership role
Strong verbal and written communication skills, collaboration capabilities, and attention to detail
Experience working on large software development projects while collaborating across multiple agile teams
Ability to work from 8:00AM-4:30PM eastern time, this is currently a full-time remote position
Ability to participate in an on-call rotation for after-hours requests


Required Technology Experience
Experience managing Azure SQL PaaS instances
Experience managing Azure Cosmos database instances
Experience working with Azure data factory to move and transform data
T-SQL
Ability to write and understand Microsoft SQL stored procedures, functions, triggers
Experience working with Microsoft SQL tables, views and other core objects
Experience managing security and access within Microsoft SQL server
Microsoft SQL server 2014 or newer
Ability to troubleshoot complex query performance issues using profiler or similar tools
Basic security concepts as it relates to Microsoft SQL and Azure Cosmos


About biBerk

biBerk is where commercial insurance buyers can obtain coverage for their businesses from insurers of the Berkshire Hathaway group of Insurance Companies, one of the best capitalized insurance groups in the world. Our parent, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (berkshirehathaway.com) is a holding company with diversified interests in a host of industries, including insurance, energy, transportation and manufacturing. Most policies issued through biBerk.com will be underwritten by Berkshire Hathaway Direct Insurance Company ("BHDIC"), which is an AM Best rated A++ insurer.

BHDIC is domiciled in Omaha, Nebraska. BHDIC and the team at biBerk are focused on helping small business owners quickly and easily buy affordable insurance directly from a financially strong insurance company they can trust.

Some Highlights of our benefits are:
Great work environment with growth opportunity
Subsidized downtown parking
Competitive compensation
Generous amounts of vacation and sick time
Closed on major holidays
401(k) with company match
A fantastic healthcare package
Tuition reimbursement after 6 months of employment


In accordance with pay transparency laws and regulations, the following good faith compensation range estimate is being provided. The salary range for this position is $130,000- $150,000 per year. Final compensation will be based on candidate qualifications, geographic location, and other considerations permitted by law.
