Ce que vous ferez :
Effectuer les taches d'administration des bases de donnees Sybase/MySQL/Vertica/PostgreSQL/MS SQL, y compris l'installation des bases de donnees, des logiciels clients, la repetition, la migration de donnees, la gestion des correctifs et la resolution de problemes.
Assurer la haute disponibilite de la base de donnees et surveiller les performances de celle-ci.
Gerer les sauvegardes et la recuperation des donnees.
Concevoir, coder, tester, deboguer, installer et effectuer l'entretien de routine des bases de donnees et des objets DB.
Examiner et proposer des ameliorations au code existant de Sybase/MySQL/Vertica/PostgreSQL/MS SQL pour ameliorer les performances.
Fournir un soutien au developpement d'applications, incluant l'analyse de base de donnees et les changements de modele de donnees, l'exportation et l'importation de donnees, le chargement et la conversion des donnees, la restauration d'anciennes donnees et l'optimisation SQL.
Apporter un soutien technique sur l'optimisation SQL et la conception d'index pour les developpeurs.
Resoudre quotidiennement les problemes de base de donnees.
Effectuer l'entretien de routine et les mises a niveau des bases de donnees ainsi que la recuperation d'urgence au besoin.
Evaluer les nouvelles productions et les fonctionnalites des bases de donnees.
Ce que nous recherchons :
Baccalaureat en ingenierie informatique ou dans des domaines equivalents.
Minimum de 5 ans d'experience en administration des serveurs de bases de donnees Sybase, MySQL et Vertica.
Experience dans la mise a niveau des serveurs de bases de donnees.
Experience en migration de bases de donnees.
Experience de gestion d'une base de donnees unique de plus de 2 To.
Experience de gestion de plus de 200 instances de bases de donnees.
Connaissances, competences et capacites
Competences analytiques et de resolution de problemes solides pour resoudre des problemes de production sous forte pression.
Maitrise de la conception, de l'administration, de la mise en uvre, des mises a niveau, de la surveillance et de la gestion des bases de donnees.
Maitrise de l'optimisation de base de donnees pour garantir une execution efficace et fiable des applications.
Experience dans l'administration d'un environnement de bases de donnees a grande echelle.
Competences en modelisation de donnees et en conception de bases de donnees.
Experience avec les bases de donnees transactionnelles et les entrepots de donnees.
Maitrise des techniques d'optimisation.
Comprehension approfondie du cycle de vie du developpement de logiciel.
Experience avec les processus de chargement de donnees et par lot.
Experience avec les procedures stockees, les declencheurs, etc.
Solides competences en communication.
Capacite a travailler de maniere autonome.
Complexite et supervision du poste
Se rapporte au gestionnaire TI des administrateurs de bases de donnees.
Conditions de travail
Doit etre disponible pour travailler en dehors des heures normales de bureau et les fins de semaine pour resoudre les problemes de bases de donnees et d'applications.
Doit egalement etre capable de travailler en rotation tot le matin et tard le soir pour les problemes de production.

Description:
A small and growing independent locally owned insurance agency office located in Summerville is in need of an amazing business office administrator. You will serve very closely with the owner and agency principal. 

We are looking for an entrepreneurial, hardworking, consistent, and persistent person to assist us with a wide variety of daily tasks. Job duties will include but not be limited to handling hundreds of both inbound and outbound phone calls per week, organization of material, assisting with administrative tasks, record-keeping, communication with clients and producers, claims assistance, local deliveries, and content creation. The ability to multi-task is an absolute must. 

This is NOT a remote work from home position. 

The job will be during normal 8AM-5PM business hours Monday through Friday with occasional evenings and Saturdays required. You absolutely need to have an amazing and delectable telephone presence. You must also be very computer literate and well versed in the use of a MAC computer, a Windows PC and Microsoft Office. You will also need to have dependable transportation. You also need to have a property and casualty insurance license AND a life, health, and accident insurance license. These licenses need to be current and in good standing with the South Carolina Department of Insurance. If you do not have these professional licenses already in place, you need to be willing and able to acquire them within 30 days of employment. If you do not currently have the necessary licenses in place, please, at minimum, do the necessary 30 minutes of research to determine what it will take for you to become licensed. Please do not apply to this position if you have not at minimum done the research to learn what it will take for you to get these licenses. 

Please reply to this post with a resume attached in PDF or word doc format. In your resume, please include your complete contact information, and at least three personal/professional references. And if you so desire, you may also include a picture of yourself.

Upon receipt of your resume, if we are impressed, we will reach out to you via email, phone, or text message to set up time for a potential face to face interview.

Who are you: We are seeking an experienced Certified Public Accountant (CPA) to join our accounting team. You’ll be responsible for participating with other DNWPA staff to accomplish a variety of accounting/tax office functions.
 Our ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge of accounting fundamentals, information systems, and tax return preparation and can collaborate with clients and staff. Daily duties will include managing client interactions including their tax and accounting needs, classifying clients' daily transactions, and recommending ways to improve their financial reporting. You will play a vital role in our client’s financial operations, ensuring compliance with accounting rules and tax laws.
 Previous work experience, along with a degree in Accounting and a CPA qualification is required for this role. This role reports directly to the CPA owner and will have the opportunity for career development.
 As a Senior Accountant CPA, you will:
 Take initiative and participate in team and individual projects as assigned
Examine & Manage Financial Information:
Perform full accounting cycle review
Oversee transaction reconciliation and manage accounts payable/receivable
Monitor client bookkeeping activities regularly
Prepare and record asset, liability, and expenses entries by compiling and analyzing account information and source documents, ensuring the integrity of input and proper classification, adjusting accordingly, and resolving discrepancies
Reconcile multiple bank and credit card accounts as needed
Maintain financial documentation according to policies and procedures
Tax Return Preparation:
Generate a year-end working trial balance for purposes of business tax return preparation
Prepare business, property, sales, and individual tax returns. Review the accuracy of total taxes calculated, obtain and file appropriate source documents to support deductions, and ensure that clients are aware of compliance requirements
Tax Planning and Advising Clients on Financial and Tax Decisions:
Drive projects, provide accounting guidance, and often serve as the primary contact for clients and their financial and business partners
Stay informed on industry developments and changes in laws and regulations
Keep all firm and client financial information confidential. NDA is required upon employment
 What you need to succeed:
Minimum 2-5 years experience in accounting, ideally with prior demonstrated experience in AP, ledger, monthly close, audits, and internal controls
Required Bachelor's degree in Accounting from an accredited University or College
Impeccable levels of attention to detail paired with the ability to execute multiple priorities in a timely and communicative manner
Moderate to advanced experience with spreadsheets - i.e. MS Excel, Google Sheets, etc.
Experience with Xero software, ADP Payroll, Citrix ShareFile, and Quickbooks
Understanding of payroll/benefit reconciliations
Familiarity with US GAAP, financial reporting, accounting metrics and principles
Possess excellent judgment abilities and a high level of professional integrity
A self-starter attitude and willingness to take initiative on new projects and drive them to successful completion
Local to Anderson/Greenville, SC
 Nice to haves:
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) certification is preferred though a candidate actively working towards certification will be considered
Passion for managing others or the willingness to move into management roles
Knowledge of website development and ongoing maintenance with WordPress
 Want to make your impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!
 Compensation Package Range: $50,000-$70,000 + Merit Bonus and Commission
 Featured benefits (subject to change):
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance considered based on needs
Simple IRA after 1 year of employment

Description:
JOB TITLE: SALES & MARKETING DATABASE SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR
DEPARTMENT: Marketing
REPORTS TO: Director of Sales & Marketing Business Systems
JOB CLASSIFICATION: Fulltime
JOB SUMMARY:
The Sales & Marketing Database Systems Administrator plays a critical role in maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of our Database Systems and related Martech software. This position focuses on enhancing productivity through database management, ensuring data cleanliness, and promoting best practices across the team. The ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving abilities, experience with Salesforce configuration in a customized for-profit environment, particularly on the Salesforce Lightning platform, as well as excellent communication skills and a keen desire to learn.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
Provide user support, including assistance with log-ins, technical issues, functionality enhancement requests, and managing user access at both object and record levels.
Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for users of database systems, understanding internal stakeholders' responsibilities and processes to enhance user experience and training.
Facilitate training sessions for new users and support rollouts of new or updated features and tools.
Audit and execute security and data integrity initiatives.
Prepare and execute data uploads and exports.
Support and train Delegated Admins effectively.
Develop declarative components in Salesforce to meet specific business needs.
Update content access to enhance user experience, focusing on page layouts and Lightning Pages for both Desktop and Mobile.
Collaborate with Developers and Outside Consultants to coordinate timelines and project requirements.
Aid in transitioning legacy automation logic to a unified automation tool, currently Flow, adhering to best practices.
Create and maintain new automation processes following industry best standards.
Develop Automation that aligns with business processes, enhancing data integrity and user experience.
Create and maintain user-oriented training materials for Sales & Marketing database systems.
Work alongside the Director of Sales & Marketing Database Systems to document change management processes within the database systems.
Conduct testing and manage User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for new and existing projects.
Maintain, design, and audit reports and dashboards in Salesforce and DOMO.
Support the Director of Sales & Marketing Database Systems with additional projects as needed.
Travel as necessary to support SSP business units.
Ensure confidentiality across all records within the databases.
Perform other tasks related to Sales & Marketing Database Systems as required.

TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Systems, or equivalent work experience.
Salesforce Admin Certification 201 is required.
Two to three years of experience in a related position is preferred.
Proficiency in administering core Salesforce functions and the Lightning UI, including user management, roles and permissions, custom objects, page layouts, custom fields, and approval processes using Flow.
Familiarity with Force.com and Custom Object Architecture is preferred.
Ability to utilize Excel to support database audit and maintenance needs.

Experience with HubSpot and Propertybase (Salesforce OEM) is a plus.
Familiarity with Google Workspace is preferred.
Excellent communication skills in both oral and written American English.
Strong technical skills with a mindset focused on leveraging database and workflow-oriented software.

SKILLS:
Strong organizational and prioritization abilities to meet deadlines while managing multiple tasks.
Capacity to deliver high-quality work efficiently in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrates courteous and cooperative behavior in interactions with staff and vendors, promoting a harmonious workplace atmosphere.
Contributes to the effectiveness and efficiency of the sales and marketing teams by providing constructive suggestions and actively participating as a team member.

Description:
As a leading regional bank, SouthState has been providing financial solutions to individuals, families, and businesses in the Southeast for more than 100 years.
SouthState team members strive to create remarkable experiences while building meaningful and lasting relationships. We are proud to be a reflection of the communities we serve and our team members share core values that make SouthState a great place to bank, and a great place to work. 
SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES
As the ServiceNow CMDB Administrator, you will be responsible for the overall administration, configuration, and maintenance of the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) within the ServiceNow platform. The role will consist of working with the networking team on credentials of hardware, create new schedules, review, and resolve discovery errors. Your role will involve ensuring the accuracy, integrity, and reliability of the CMDB, as well as supporting various IT processes and initiatives related to configuration management. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
o    Monitor for issues (firewalls, credentials, etc.) with the existing schedules.
o    Create new schedules as network changes occur, such as acquisitions.
o    Update existing credentials if security requirements change.
o    Work with technical resources if new equipment requires new discovery processes/credentials.
o    Continually monitor and optimize existing discovery configuration, i.e.. reduce discovery run-time.
o    Administer and maintain the ServiceNow CMDB, including its configuration, data integrity, and ongoing synchronization with other IT systems and data sources. 
o    Perform regular audits and reconciliation activities to ensure the accuracy and completeness of CMDB data, identifying and resolving any inconsistencies or discrepancies. 
o    Collaborate with other IT teams to ensure proper integration and alignment of CMDB data with other IT processes such as incident, problem, and change management. 
o    Ensure the integration and support of the Configuration Management process to the other ITIL processes such as Incident, Problem, Change, Release, etc. 
o    Plan, manage and control the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) to ensure the accuracy of configuration data and proper reporting and status accounting.
o    Continuous improvements for the automation and maintenance of non-discoverable data attributes including integration of other asset management systems as required.
o    Conduct data quality analysis, provide recommendations to address data quality issues, and manage the implementation of approved recommendations.
o    Manage Configuration Item review attestations to ensure accuracy and completeness of undiscoverable configuration items maintained within the CMDB.
o    Participates in the planning, designing, and implementing of the Service Model in CMDB to ensure visibility across the infrastructure environment.
o    Manage and define Configuration Management exception criteria, as well as tracking, reporting and workflows.
COMPETENCIES
o    Advanced knowledge MS Office tools, particularly Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Word, and SharePoint
o    Advanced understanding of businesses supported.
o    Strong written and verbal communication skills
o    Ability to learn and grasp new concepts and business processes quickly.
o    Detail-oriented with ability to communicate with diverse stakeholders.
o    Organizational skills: ability to multi-task and prioritize; strong attention to detail; ability to work in a dynamic environment, independently and within teams.
o    Highly motivated self - starter.
Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements
Education: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline or comparable experience
Experience:
o    3+ years relevant experience in a Service Asset & Configuration Management capacity and Service Mapping
o    Solid experience in administering and configuring the ServiceNow CMDB, including CI classes, attributes, relationships, and workflows.
o    Strong knowledge of configuration management principles and best practices. 
o    Proficiency in ServiceNow platform administration, including knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM modules.
o    Familiarity with ITIL practices and processes, particularly in configuration management. 
o    Excellent problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented approach to data analysis and reconciliation. 
o    Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at various levels.
o    Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
o    Demonstrated ability to assess environments, conduct gap analysis, recommend improvements, develop, and implement best practices, processes, and methodologies.
o    Knowledge of workflow process documentation and analysis.
o    Detail oriented with superior organizational and analytical skills.
o    Self-motivated and able to work independently and take initiative in identifying and addressing challenges.
o    Experienced in effectively coordinating multiple initiatives and working with conflicting priorities in a fast-paced environment.
o    Superior written and verbal communication/presentation skills with the ability to interact with various stakeholders across the organization.
o    Flexible to work in a constantly changing, high-pressure environment 
Certifications/Specific Knowledge:
o    ServiceNow certifications, such as Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) for IT Service Management or Certified System Administrator (CSA), ITIL Practitioner Level Certification an asset are highly desirable.
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES
o    Required annual compliance training.
o    New Employee Orientation
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, and reports. This position requires a large amount of time in front of a computer. This can be done sitting or standing with use of the right desk. 
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Telecommuting roles no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. They must also have a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred.  Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered. Travel may be required to come to meetings as needed.

Innovation:We foster a culture of innovation, encouraging our employees to think creatively and embrace new ideas. We continuously seek opportunities to improve and evolve, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and approaches to deliver innovative solutions and exceed customer expectations.
Collaboration:We believe in the power of collaboration and teamwork. We value diverse perspectives and actively promote a collaborative work environment where employees can share knowledge, support each other, and work towards common goals. By working together, we achieve excellence and drive success for our company and our customers.

Why Join Us

Continued Education and Growth Opportunities:We believe in investing in our employees' professional development. We encourage lifelong learning and provide resources to support your personal and professional growth.
Paid Holidays:We understand the importance of work-life balance and the value of spending time with loved ones. To support this, we offer paid holidays to our employees, ensuring that you have dedicated time off to relax, recharge, and celebrate special moments with family and friends.

Job Description

MANDEX Government Property Administrator/LOG 3

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly qualified and experienced Government Property Administrator to join the MANDEX team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of government property management. This role requires a combination of strong leadership skills, logistical expertise, and a thorough understanding of government property administration. The Government Property Administrator will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient day-to-day tracking of government property.

Key Responsibilities:
Performing inventory database input, preparing GFP records in accordance with applicable rules and regulations and conducting compliance audits and self-assessments.
Utilizing computer-based inventory and bar-coding system for entry, id and tracking of materials.
Providing real-time material status reports and related logistics functions.
Preparing operational management/user documents/reports.
Assisting receiving officer in validation of distributor delivery commitments.
Ensuring compliance with relevant regulations, policies, and procedures governing logistics and procurement activities, including Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and DoD procurement policies.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in logistics or a related field.
Minimum of 6 years of experience in logistics support, preferably in a government contracting environment with at least 1 year of experience in government property management.
Familiarity with use of the GFP module of the Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE) strongly preferred.
Strong understanding of logistics principles, practices, and processes, with experience in defense life-cycle logistics support.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe.
Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively lead cross-functional teams and communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
Familiarity with relevant regulations and standards governing logistics and procurement activities, including FAR and DoD procurement policies.
Logistics certification (e.g., DAU) preferred.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and make a significant impact on our organization's success. We look forward to welcoming a talented and motivated individual who can drive excellence in logistics operations.

SECURITY:

U.S Citizenship required.

LOCATION:

North Charleston, SC

Description:
H2 Performance Consulting is subject to the Vietnam Era Veteran's Readjustment Assistance Act as a Federal Contractor and is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strives to build a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status or disability status. Additionally, as mandated under Executive order 12989, H2 is required to verify employment eligibility of selected candidates through the Department of Labor’s - E-Verify.
H2 Performance Consulting (H2) is seeking a Senior Oracle DBA to create, update, configure, manage, and administer databases for Oracle 12c - 19c environments. The ideal candidate must be able to create, edit and execute scripts to process data and perform software updates. You will be required to create instances with the ability to modify control files, redo logs, archive log and other parameters as required. This role will be relied on to provide IT project management guidance/input and expertise for projects and special projects as needed. The candidate must be able to integrate DBMS(s) data with existing application software, websites, portals, storage devices, or business applications as well as assisting and testing Disaster Recovery (DR) and Continuity of Operations Plans (COOP). The position will have a strong focus on performance tuning. Must have an extensive knowledge in database performance tuning in both data center and cloud environments.
The Senior Oracle Database Administrator responsibilities will include:
Install, configure, and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities.
Configure and document security measures as required by DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs).
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes.
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems.
Create, update, configure, manage, and administer databases for Oracle 12c - 19c environments.
Create, edit, and execute scripts to process data and perform software updates.
Create instances with the ability to modify control files, redo logs, archive log and other parameters as required.
Provide IT project management guidance/input and expertise for projects and special projects as needed.
Integrate DBMS(s) data with existing application software, websites, portals, storage devices, or business applications.
Assist and test Disaster Recovery (DR) and Continuity of Operations Plans (COOP).
Conduct performance tuning activities using various Oracle tools and database metrics.
Review PL/SQL packages, procedures, functions for performance issues.
Implement oracle security features such as fips140 communication and DoD CAC/PKI authentication for Oracle products.
Qualifications and Education Requirements:
Clearance: Minimum SECRET clearance. Will require a T5 (if they do not have a TS) from the Government after they start.
Required Certifications:
DoD 8570 IAT Level II – CompTIA Security+ CE or equivalent at date of hire.
Operating System (OS) training within 30 days after start date.
Experience:
5+ years of advanced database performance tuning.
Experience in analyzing and determining cause/solutions of wait events.
Experience with Oracle performance monitoring tools such as AWR to include capturing and analyzing reports.
Ability to write simple to complex PL/SQL queries along with ability to understand execution plan of existing ones and adjust them as needed.
Previous experience with installation, configuration, and tuning of Middleware; Deploying EAR & WAR files.
Experience with Solaris, Linux, and Windows Administration ideal.
Comfortable with High Availability and Disaster Recovery technologies.
Experience using RMAN to perform various database backups and recover databases from backups including partials, point in time, and full recovery.
Experience cloning databases using RMAN and Data Pump
Ability to handle implementing, configuring, and monitoring Oracle Data Guard, including standby reporting databases with little to no assistance.
Experience encrypting SQL traffic between clients and database, including thick clients and data sources.
Knowledge of implementing database authentication using common access cards and Oracle wallets required.
Experience implementing Oracle auditing processes including Oracle Unified Auditing.
5-7 years’ experience with monitoring, analyzing server logs, and configuring additional logging.
Experience engaging with Oracle Corporation for technical support.
Experience with Oracle Advanced Security, Oracle Fusion Architecture, RAC, and ASM.
Familiarity with Oracle Database development is a plus.
Senior level proficiency in key systems (minimal training required)
Must have an extensive knowledge in database performance tuning in both data center and cloud environments (AWS Preferred).
Experience administering SQL Server/ DB is a plus.
Qualified candidates may submit their resume to the career section of our company website at http://www.h2pc.com. All resumes will be reviewed within 5 business days and those candidates we wish to further in the application process will be contacted via email/phone to schedule initial phone screens.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for users of database systems, understanding internal stakeholders' responsibilities and processes to enhance user experience and training.
Facilitate training sessions for new users and support rollouts of new or updated features and tools.
Audit and execute security and data integrity initiatives.
Prepare and execute data uploads and exports.
Support and train Delegated Admins effectively.
Develop declarative components in Salesforce to meet specific business needs.
Update content access to enhance user experience, focusing on page layouts and Lightning Pages for both Desktop and Mobile.
Collaborate with Developers and Outside Consultants to coordinate timelines and project requirements.
Aid in transitioning legacy automation logic to a unified automation tool, currently Flow, adhering to best practices.
Create and maintain new automation processes following industry best standards.
Develop Automation that aligns with business processes, enhancing data integrity and user experience.
Create and maintain user-oriented training materials for Sales & Marketing database systems.
Work alongside the Director of Sales & Marketing Database Systems to document change management processes within the database systems.
Conduct testing and manage User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for new and existing projects.
Maintain, design, and audit reports and dashboards in Salesforce and DOMO.
Support the Director of Sales & Marketing Database Systems with additional projects as needed.
Travel as necessary to support SSP business units.
Ensure confidentiality across all records within the databases.
Perform other tasks related to Sales & Marketing Database Systems as required.

TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Systems, or equivalent work experience.
Salesforce Admin Certification 201 is required.
Two to three years of experience in a related position is preferred.
Proficiency in administering core Salesforce functions and the Lightning UI, including user management, roles and permissions, custom objects, page layouts, custom fields, and approval processes using Flow.
Familiarity with Force.com and Custom Object Architecture is preferred.
Ability to utilize Excel to support database audit and maintenance needs.
Experience with HubSpot and Propertybase (Salesforce OEM) is a plus.
Familiarity with Google Workspace is preferred.
Excellent communication skills in both oral and written American English.
Strong technical skills with a mindset focused on leveraging database and workflow-oriented software.
SKILLS:
Strong organizational and prioritization abilities to meet deadlines while managing multiple tasks.
Capacity to deliver high-quality work efficiently in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrates courteous and cooperative behavior in interactions with staff and vendors, promoting a harmonious workplace atmosphere.
Contributes to the effectiveness and efficiency of the sales and marketing teams by providing constructive suggestions and actively participating as a team member.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Constant and close visual work at computer.
Constant sitting and working at desk.
Frequent verbal and written communication with staff and other business associates by telephone,
correspondence, or in person.
Must be able to lift objects weighing between 0 and 30 lbs.
Ability to stand, stoop, bend and lift.
Must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a
computer, stamina to maintain attention to detail.
Vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone.
Must be available to travel on occasion to locations for training and/or conferences for future educational development as well as travel to offsite sales & marketing events.
Kiawah Partners offers competitive compensation based on experience. Benefits are also included*.
*Benefits are available to full-time employees after a waiting period and include: Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Telehealth, Health/Dependent Care spending account, Wellness Program and generous paid time off including 12 vacation days, 6 sick days and 9 paid holidays per year.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

Description:
Description:
Why Everstory

At Everstory Partners, our mission is to create supportive spaces where individuals and families can find solace, meaning, and hope in the midst of loss. At the heart of our mission is a deep understanding of the profound and complex nature of grief. Every person’s journey through loss is unique, and we are committed to providing compassionate and personalized support.

We also believe that grief is not a problem to be solved or a burden to manage alone, but rather a natural and beautiful part of the human experience. Backed by our national strength and our local partners’ role is to be a steady presence, a source of comfort and guidance, and a partner in celebrating the life and legacy of the person who has passed.

The Impact You Will Make

The Administrator role at Everstory is a vital part of the location team and is multi-faceted with the ability to learn multiple parts of the business while supporting our customers and team members. In this position, no two days will be the same. You will be responsible for creating a customer focused environment with every interaction you have through answering phones, scheduling appointments, helping on-board team members and assisting your locations leadership team. You will also be responsible for:
Contract processing and quality control, including verification that all contracts are valid before entry.
Banking duties: cash receipt entry, deposit slips, credit card transactions and bank deposits. May include trips to the bank for actual cash deposits.
Cemetery daily processing of IOA’s (Interment Order and Authorization), following the company standards and policies.
File maintenance and record keeping: update customer files including all new sales and burials. Scan all documentations as required. Maintain Records of all memos, e-mails, corporate policies, and programs implemented.
Human Resources: coordinate onboarding responsibilities as needed.
Accounts Payable: Insure all bills are paid promptly. Process all purchases and invoices through the current system.
Accounts Receivable: Collection of past and present balance amounts due for any delinquent location customer contracts.
Deeds and Certificates: Provide deeds and certificates to Sales Management each week. Log and process according to your location and or state guidelines. Trust Certificates: Check for accuracy, compare to contracts, sign and place in custom file return (email) to the Home Office Trust Department.
Work and Memorial Orders – Order Memorials when PIF (Paid in Full). Manage work orders for Park Services.
White Board Meetings– Take part in daily meetings between Administration, Maintenance, and Sales Department.
Reporting: may include Trust, state required, and month end processing.
Core Competencies:
Compassion - Genuinely cares about people; is concerned about their work and non-work problems; is available and ready to help; is sympathetic to the plight of others not as fortunate; demonstrates real empathy with the joys and pains of others.
Customer Focus - Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Ethics and Values - Adheres to appropriate (for the setting) and effective set of core values and beliefs during both good and bad times; acts in line with those values; rewards the right values and disapproves of others; practices what he/she preaches.
Requirements:
Basics: Multi-Line phone skills required. Filing skills (Alphabetically). Ability to type 40 words per minute with minimal errors and data entry skills. Basic math and computer skills including word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) applications or Google equivalents.
Customer Focus: Ability to abide by all company policies and keep all employee and customer information confidential. Excellent customer service skills and optimal interpersonal skills.
Team Focus: Proficient organizational skills. Ability to multitask efficiently and work well independently or as part of a team. Ability to effectively and quickly complete tasks and assignments and meet deadlines.
Must possess a valid state driver’s license and have access to a personal vehicle for some locations.
High School equivalency required.
Minimum of one-year experience in administration or customer service.
Our Investment in You

Everstory Partners is proud to provide our employees with a quality work environment and opportunity for both personal and professional growth. As part of our ongoing commitment, we offer a competitive benefits package for our Full-Time Employees including: Medical, Dental, 401k with a company match, Life, Short-Term Disability, Long-term Disability, Vision, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Discount Programs, Generous PTO Programs, Volunteer Opportunities & much more!

Everstory Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.

Description:
IT Systems Administrator
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: Director of Information Technology
FLSA Status: Exempt (Salary

JOB SUMMARY
Under limited supervision, responsible for the installation, availability, reliability, performance and maintenance of supported systems. Works with IT staff in training employees on IT equipment, applications and procedures. Responds to emergency IT situations during off-hours as required. This includes day-to-day management, operational support, upgrade and implementations, and long-term planning for systems including but not limited to Microsoft Windows Server platforms, and related software applications. Coordinates maintenance and ensures the proper operation of core systems and applications. Provides Tier 2 support to the organization.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of the duties does not exclude them from the classification if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment for this classification. Other duties may be required and assigned.
Duties include but are not limited to:
Responsible for remote monitoring and management (RMM) environment.
Responsible for Windows platforms, including but not limited to Windows Servers, Windows Domain Services, etc.
Coordinating administration using Windows Active Directory to include group policies, replication, troubleshooting and upgrades.
Responsible for configuration and day-to-day operations of Enterprise printing environment, including maintenance to keep environment current and secure.
Responsible for desktop experience, including image deployment, user state migration tools, software advertisements, and application metering.
Performs maintenance activities as needed to keep environments up-to-date with urgent patches, releases, etc. as well as remaining secure.
Develops procedures, forms, exhibits and hardware/software documentation.
Responsible for Office365 ecosystem/platform.
Assists Director of IT with Server Lifecycle Plan.
Evaluates hardware and software to meet user requirements; makes written and verbal recommendations for user or management review.
Monitors related systems and applications to ensure performance is in optimal working order at all times.
Analyzes, reviews, and alters computer systems to maintain and increase operating efficiency and system resources, minimize support and maintenance or adapt to new requirements.
Trains users on software, hardware, and operating systems; utilizing appropriate training material or arranges training with training coordinator.
Identifies equipment specifications and orders IT equipment in accordance with budget set by Director of IT.
Assists Director of IT with the IT Continuity Plan. This plan includes identification of critical business functions supported by core applications and hardware with associated recovery time objectives, mitigation strategies, and resource requirements to ensure IT operational continuity. The plan addresses cybersecurity and documentation of disaster recovery procedures for IT datacenters and communications.
Provides Tier2 support to the organization.
Performs root cause analysis and develops checklists for typical problems.
Documents internal policies and/or develops training material for end-users.
Keeps abreast of new developments in field; includes self-study and company provided training.
Performs other related duties as assigned to ensure effective operation of department.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A bachelor's degree in information technology systems, computer science, or a related field and experience in information technology systems or a related area. Relevant experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree on a year-for-year basis. Must possess and maintain a valid SC driver's license.
Required Certifications:
Microsoft Certified: Information Protection and Compliance Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate


Job Posted by ApplicantPro
Title: IT Systems Administrator

Qualification:
High School Diplomas or Equivalent.
Previous set-up fixture experience required.
At least two years of CNC lathe and milling experience required with setup, fixturing and operation.
Strong CNC programming experience preferred.
Previous CMM experience required.
Must have exceptional problem solving abilities.
Must be able to work independently.
Must be detail oriented and organized.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Carry out the detailed analysis of all production faults to determine root causes, preventative and corrective actions and to methodically eliminate faults using modern problem-solving techniques.
Implement and develop improvements to increase production, efficiency, and overall quality, while reducing costs.
Assist in the development and training of multi-skilled teams.
Ensure that all health and safety and environmental issues and improvements are maintained leading to a safe working environment.
Carry out effective shift handover with the oncoming shift to adequately communicate key information.
Ensure good housekeeping and safety practices are adhered to using the 5S tool.
Ensure process documentation is in place, being used, and make recommendations for improvements.
Support the implementation and launch of new products or processes into production.
Ensure proper management, control, and replenishment of consumables.
Work closely with the management team to ensure that any production, quality, and engineering problem is reacted to quickly or escalated to the appropriate site manager to ensure that corrective actions can be taken.
Other duties as assigned.
This role may have the opportunity to specialize or cross-train in different disciplines within the company. Below are some duties that may be performed within each of these disciplines.
Assigned duties are not limited to this list.
Operations-specific:
Produce parts daily when the scheduled operator is unavailable.
Conduct periodic audits of production processes.
Assist in troubleshooting of machines, including resetting alarms and making offsets as needed.
Perform or assist in production set-ups, tool change and the setup of sister tools sister tooling.
Performs inventories and assist in preparing shipments as needed (forklift certification required)
Quality-specific:
Administer scrap and rework information.
Responsible for reporting customer-specific data.
Monitor production parts as needed.
Responsible for scrap and rework production.
Measuring and collecting PPAP and other data.
Administer gauge calibration and database.
Administer the LPA program.
Engineering-specific:
Revise, develop, and document simple preventative maintenance tasks on equipment.
Manually machine parts as needed to support demand maintenance activities.
Support the fluid management program.
Perform monthly preventive maintenance activities as needed.
Shift Pattern - 4-week rotation of:
1st shift - 5:45 am to 2:15pm
2nd shift - 1:45 pm to 10:15pm +$0.5
3rd shift - 9:45 pm to 6:15am +$1
Physical Demands
Prolong sitting, standing, walking and reaching with hands and arms, frequent lifting and/or moving up to 40 pounds, bending, crawling, climbing and kneeling. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, colour vision, depth perception and ability to adjust and focus. Manual dexterity required for operating machinery, computers and other office equipment.
Working Environment
Working conditions are normal for a manufacturing environment, noise level is moderate. Work will require rotating shifts. Work may involve lifting of materials and product up to 40 pounds. Working in this environment requires the use of safety equipment to include but not limited to; eye safety glasses, hearing protection, work boots, hardhats, gloves, aprons. Loose fitting clothes and jewellery are not permitted on shop floor. Exposure to chemicals and/or fumes probable.

Purpose
The Contracts and Licensing Administrator manages and coordinates all aspects of contract preparation, review,
execution, and compliance. This role ensures that contractual obligations are met, risks are minimized, and all
agreements comply with legal, regulatory, and organizational standards. The Contracts Administrator liaises
between the Regional Vice President (RVP) and the legal team to facilitate smooth contract management
processes.
Recruit Position Duties
Responsible for managing and maintaining all licenses, permits, and certifications required for the organizations
operations. This role ensures timely renewals, accurate record-keeping, and compliance with local, state, and
federal regulations. The ideal candidate is highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive in supporting the
business licensing and compliance needs.
Key Responsibilities for Contracts
Contract Drafting and Review:
o Prepare, review, and edit contracts, agreements, and amendments to ensure accuracy, completeness, and
compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
o Collaborate with legal counsel to address complex legal or contractual issues.
Contract Management:
o Maintain an organized database of all contracts, including tracking key milestones, deadlines, and renewal
dates.
o Monitor compliance with contractual terms and conditions, identifying and addressing potential breaches.
Compliance and Reporting:
o Ensure all contracts adhere to applicable laws, regulations, and organizational policies.
o Generate reports and summaries for management, providing insights into contract statuses and
performance.
RVP Collaboration:
o Work closely with procurement, finance, legal, and operational teams to align contract terms with
organizational objectives.
o Serve as a subject matter expert on contractual matters to support RVP.
Continuous Improvement:
o Develop and implement best practices for contract management processes.
o Stay updated on industry trends, legal changes, and best practices related to contract administration.
General Statement - Performs the job assigned, complying with Company policies and procedures, business code of ethics, FLSA regulations, and all applicable laws, as well as ensuring confidentiality, reliability, quality, and productivity.
Key Responsibilities for Licenses and Compliance
License Management:
Coordinate the application, renewal, and maintenance of business licenses, permits, and certifications.
Monitor expiration dates and ensure timely submissions to avoid lapses in compliance.
Maintain an up-to-date database of all licenses, permits, and associated documentation.
Regulatory Compliance:
Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal licensing requirements.
Stay informed of changes in licensing laws and regulations that impact the organization.
Serve as a liaison with regulatory agencies to address licensing-related inquiries or issues.
Documentation and Record-Keeping:
Organize and manage electronic and physical files for all licensing and compliance documents.
Prepare and submit reports, forms, and other documentation as regulatory authorities require.
Develop and maintain a checklist to track ongoing compliance requirements.
Communication and Coordination:
Communicate with internal teams to gather information for licensing applications and renewals.
Administrative Support:
Provide general administrative support, including scheduling, correspondence, and data entry.
Assist in preparing compliance reports and presentations for management.
Manage invoices and payments related to licensing fees and regulatory filings.
Process Improvement:
Identify opportunities to streamline licensing processes and improve efficiency.
Recommend and implement tools or software to enhance licensing management.
Perform all other duties and projects as assigned by Leadership
Recruit Position Schedule
Full time position. Minimum 40-hour workweek and availability on weekends and evenings. Some nights and Saturdays may be required for meeting attendance
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education, Essential Training / Certifications, and Experience:
High School diploma/GED
Bachelors degree in business administration, Law, or a related field
Certification in Contract Management (e.g.CPCM, CCCM) is a plus
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in contract administration, procurement, or legal roles.
Administrative support, licensing, compliance, or a similar role.
Familiarity with Business Licensing processes and regulations is highly desirable
Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:
Strong understanding of contract law and principles.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Exceptional attention to detail, organizational skills, and accuracy in record-keeping.
Time Management skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), database management tools, and DocuSign.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple deadlines.

We are currently seeking a team member who believes in the “extra mile” philosophy to fulfill our Accounting Administrative Specialist role.
The Accounting Administrative Specialist is responsible for ensuring all codes and data in the various accounting files are relevant and up-to-date in order to provide accurate database structures for financial and ancillary reporting.
What You’ll Do on a Typical Day:
• Adheres to all policies, procedures, and values of Snider Fleet Solutions
• Add, delete, and/or modify general ledger codes
• Maintain an accurate chart of accounts
• Update financial report formats
• Ensure “add-on” financial software is current with all necessary general ledger codes and coding string
• Assist the AP Manager with updating the AP Master Vendor File and setting up new vendors
• Assist the Sales Tax Accountant with maintaining tax codes/rates within the ERP
• Facilitate the achievement of department objectives and controls to increase accuracy and efficiency
• Administer ancillary accounting programs such as AP Invoice Automation, P Card, and Fuel Card
• Other projects as necessary
This position is based at the company’s corporate office. The majority of this position will consist of normal office tasks and interaction amongst peers and Snider branches. Description
NexGen Data Systems is seeking a Senior Oracle DBA to create, update, configure, manage, and administer databases for Oracle 12c - 19c environments.  The ideal candidate must be able to create, edit and execute scripts to process data and perform software updates. You will be required to create instances with the ability to modify control files, redo logs, archive log and other parameters as required. This role will be relied on to provide IT project management guidance/input and expertise for projects and special projects as needed. The candidate must be able to integrate DBMS(s) data with existing application software, websites, portals, storage devices, or business applications as well as assisting and testing Disaster Recovery (DR) and Continuity of Operations Plans (COOP).  The position will have a strong focus on performance tuning. Must have an extensive knowledge in database performance tuning in both data center and cloud environments. 

Roles and Responsibilities: 
Install, configure, and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security 
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities 
Configure and document security measures as required by DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) 
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes 
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems 
Create, update, configure, manage, and administer databases for Oracle 12c - 19c environments.  
Create, edit, and execute scripts to process data and perform software updates.  
Create instances with the ability to modify control files, redo logs, archive log and other parameters as required. 
Provide IT project management guidance/input and expertise for projects and special projects as needed.
Integrate DBMS(s) data with existing application software, websites, portals, storage devices, or business applications  
Assist and test Disaster Recovery (DR) and Continuity of Operations Plans (COOP).
Conduct performance tuning activities using various Oracle tools and database metrics. 
Review PL/SQL packages, procedures, functions for performance issues. 
Implement oracle security features such as fips140 communication and DoD CAC/PKI authentication for Oracle products. 
Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. 
Requirements
Desired/Required Skills: 
5+ years of advanced database performance tuning. 
Experience in analyzing and determining cause/solutions of wait events. 
Experience with Oracle performance monitoring tools such as AWR to include capturing and analyzing reports.  
Secret clearance or higher preferred
8570 compliance (Active Security and OS certifications)
Ability to write simple to complex PL/SQL queries along with ability to understand execution plan of existing ones and adjust them as needed.  
Previous experience with installation, configuration, and tuning of Middleware; Deploying EAR & WAR files. 
Experience with Solaris, Linux, and Windows Administration ideal.  
Comfortable with High Availability and Disaster Recovery technologies. 
Experience using RMAN to perform various database backups and recover databases from backups including partials, point in time, and full recovery. 
Experience cloning databases using RMAN and Data Pump 
Ability to handle implementing, configuring, and monitoring Oracle Data Guard, including standby reporting databases with little to no assistance.  
Experience encrypting SQL traffic between clients and database, including thick clients and data sources. 
Knowledge of implementing database authentication using common access cards and Oracle wallets required. 
Experience implementing Oracle auditing processes including Oracle Unified Auditing. 
5-7 years' experience with monitoring, analyzing server logs, and configuring additional logging. 
Experience engaging with Oracle Corporation for technical support. 
Experience with Oracle Advanced Security, Oracle Fusion Architecture, RAC, and ASM. 
Familiarity with Oracle Database development is a plus. 
Senior level proficiency in key systems (minimal training required) 
Must have an extensive knowledge in database performance tuning in both data center and cloud environments (AWS Preferred).  
Experience administering SQL Server/ DB is a plus. 
 About the Company:
NexGen Data Systems is an emerging technologies focused company providing expert systems and network engineering solutions to the Department of Defense. 11 paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) accrual level starts at 15 days annually.

Description:
Looking for a career where hard work is valued, and your ideas and feedback are part of the way we operate daily? Want to bring your skills to a company that encourages teamwork and champions continued education and process improvement?
Atlas Tech, a veteran-owned IT company serving multiple DoD customers in support of America's warfighters, is looking for a Subcontracts Administer to join our team in beautiful North Charleston, SC. This position currently allows for working from home 3 days a week and 2 days onsite, Atlas reserves the right to adjust this schedule.
The Subcontracts Administrator will perform procurement related functions for subcontractor and material purchasing by providing support for the preparation of solicitations, negotiating subcontractor proposals and subcontracts, and acting as the buyer for materials, supplies, and services above and below the micro purchase threshold for all programs being supported. This position requires knowledge and hands-on experience in government contracting methods and applicable procurement laws and regulations, including but not limited to CPSR, FAR, and DFAR requirements. This position will report directly to the Director of Contracts.
You Will:
Provide pre-award and proposal support including the negotiation and issuance of non-disclosure agreements and teaming agreements, preparation of compliant competitive and single/sole source solicitation packages to subcontractors, and evaluation of subcontractor proposals to include price and cost analysis
Provide post-award support to include the negotiation of subcontract agreement terms and conditions (including identification and inclusion of flow down requirements from the prime contract), administration of multiple types of subcontracts (level of effort cost reimbursement type contracts (CPFF), time and materials (T&M), indefinite delivery indefinite quantity (IDIQ); firm fixed price (FFP); and agreements issued under other transactions), as well as all modifications thereto
Develop and administer small business subcontracting plans
Maintain quality working relationships between our subcontractors and the programs being supported
Identify and resolve issues throughout the subcontract lifecycle
Perform all subcontract close-out activities
Source and procure a variety of complex or technical goods as well as a high volume of small dollar value commercial off the shelf items to include tracking purchases, monitoring vendor quality, and maintaining a current database of vendor information
Implement companywide process improvements to include both the refinement of existing purchasing system procedures and the creation of new ones as needed to achieve CPSR readiness
Work closely with Atlas Tech team members across the company to effectively solve problems and collaborate on projects for the greater good of the company, there is no job too big or small
All other duties assigned
You Have:
Experience in the defense contracting industry with a range of contract functions throughout the full lifecycle of Federal Government subcontract administration
Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Excel and Word
The ability to quickly learn new software programs, including but not limited to our ERP system, and to work efficiently in a computerized/digital environment
The ability to make decisions and solve problems proactively using sound, inclusive reasoning and judgement
The ability to manage projects that have company-wide impacts independently to include setting milestones and deadlines, resolving issues, managing time and resources efficiently, and evaluating results
A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, and at least 3-5 years of related experience (experience will be considered in lieu of a degree)
Knowledge of and the ability to analyze, interpret, and ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, terms, conditions, and policies governing assigned contracts, including FAR, DFAR, and CPSR requirements
Pride in your work product, excellent attention to detail, and strong written and verbal communications skills
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively as a member of a team with initiative, creative thinking, innovation, and a positive attitude
Versatility and a hunger to expand your knowledge base and skillset in a way that allows you to achieve professional growth and a better understanding of the big picture
A can-do attitude and the ability to see what needs to be done and subsequently take ownership of identifying and performing or delegating the steps required to accomplish it without significant oversight
Mastered time and workload management and can think on your feet to effectively prioritize in a mission driven fast paced environment
Want to hear more? Read on to see what our Team Members say about their experience:
“To me, the best part about working at Atlas is the level of transparency afforded to everyone in the company. I’ve had plenty of jobs where I knew what I was doing, but at Atlas there is a concerted effort to make sure we also understand why, and how our role directly impacts the overall mission.” - Jess
“With LEARNING as a core value, Atlas is constantly promoting ways to increase knowledge and stay at the forefront of the latest technology. Team members are regularly encouraged to continue learning and Atlas provides training resources and skills enhancement opportunities internally as well as education reimbursement if you prefer to obtain skills through outside resources or higher education.” - Wendy
Atlas Tech is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, or protected veteran status. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where diverse perspectives are valued and respected.

Accessibility & Accommodations
Atlas Tech strives to make our website, www.atlas-tech.com, accessible to all users. If you need assistance completing the application process or require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at hr.recruiter@atlas-tech.com.

This contact information is designated for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of an application. Atlas Tech is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
Atlas Tech offers a competitive salary, generous benefits package, and an opportunity to make a positive impact in your own community.

  Job Title: Media Specialist
FLSA:  Exempt
190 days
Salary Range:  $43,639.49 - $86,598.23
Job Description: Media Specialist
Function: To develop, implement and maintain integrated information technology programs and services to ensure that students and staff are effective users of ideas and information.
Directly responsible to: Principals
Supervises: Media Assistants (as assigned)
 
As Information Specialist
Serve as a member of professional committees for the development of activities, training materials and programs to disseminate information technology.
Support and participate in cooperative resource sharing with other information technology centers and local state and national information agencies through loan services and electronic communication formats.
Involve patrons in selection and evaluation of materials, information databases and related equipment to support learning objectives.
Provide teachers with information about new materials and current information technology developments in their specific instructional areas.
Provide consultative services in selection, purchase, evaluation and use of information technology resources.
Implement a public relations program that promotes literacy and use of the information technology center, services and resources.
Maintain a central collection of statistical data, media/technology review, publisher/vendor catalogs and other pertinent information for educators.
Provide a developmentally appropriate collection for resources that meet the information and recreational needs of all students.
 
As Teacher
Participate in professional development opportunities provided and/or promoted by district, state and national organizations.
Provide in-service training and information for teachers to promote effective utilization of information technology and the development of innovative instructional activities.
Assist patrons in the production of learning materials such as multimedia, video, photography, etc.
Partner with teacher in integrating information literacy strategies with appropriate curriculum activities.
 
As an Instructional Partner
Participate in the design of the total school curriculum and instructional program.
Provide facilities and opportunities for individual and group study and production of resources.
Use open access model to provide patrons with full accessibility to the information technology resources.
Establish an environment that encourages creative and independent use of all types of information technology.
Contribute to students" development in reading, viewing, listening, evaluating and communicating using available technologies.
Plan collaboratively with teachers to ensure that a variety of resources and information literacy skills are integrated with classroom instruction.
 
As Program Administrator
Plan, implement and evaluate information technology services to best meet student needs, district goals and school objectives.
Monitor standards, guidelines, emerging practices and innovations in the library, media and information technology and education fields.
Develop and administer the budget and maintain appropriate records.
Organize and circulate information technology materials, services and related equipment for easy accessibility according to established district standards.
Maintain a centralized, up-to-date bibliographic database for school information technology resources using the district automation system.
Maintain and/or provide access to a professional library and education related informational databases to assist school educators.
Manage the information technology center with procedures that facilitate maximum use of services and resources.
Provide storage, distribution and system of accountability for information technology resources.
Supervise staff assigned to the information technology center.
 
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Ability to effectively relate to students and staff.
Ability to maintain effective working relationships with co-workers.
Broad knowledge of materials in all formats.
Knowledge of curriculum content.
Leadership and organizational qualities.
Minimum training and experience
South  Carolina certification as media specialist

Minimum Qualifications and Standards Required
Physical Requirements:
Must be physically able to operate a variety of automated office machines and equipment, including a computer, audio-visual equipment, typewriter, adding machine, telephone, etc.  Must be able to exert up to ten pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.  Physical demands are in excess of those for sedentary work; must be able to remain on feet for extended periods of time.  Must be able to lift/carry weights of up to twenty-five pounds.

Data Conception:
Requires the ability to compare and/or judge the readily observable, functional, structural or compositional characteristics (whether similar to or divergent from obvious standards) of data, people or things.

Interpersonal Communication:
Requires the ability of speaking and/or signaling people to convey or exchange information.  Includes receiving assignments and/or directions from supervisors and giving instructions to helpers.

Language Ability:
Requires the ability to read a variety of policy and procedure manuals, reference materials, etc.  Requires the ability to enter data into computer and prepare reports, records, correspondence, etc., with proper format, punctuation, spelling and grammar, using all parts of speech.  Must be able to speak with poise, voice control and confidence and to articulate information to others. 

Intelligence:
Requires the ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagrammatic form, to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in or from standardized situations.  Requires the ability to make independent judgments in the absence of supervisor, and to acquire knowledge of topics related to primary occupation.  Must have the ability to comprehend and interpret received information and the ability to comprehend and implement basic office machinery functions.

Verbal Aptitude:
Requires the ability to record and deliver information, to explain procedures, to follow oral and written instructions.  Must be able to communicate effectively and efficiently with persons of varying educational backgrounds.

Numerical Aptitude:
Requires the ability to add and subtract totals, to multiply and divide, to determine percentages and decimals, to determine time.  Must be able to use practical applications of fractions, percentages, ratio and proportion.

Form/Spatial Aptitude:
Requires the ability to inspect items for proper length, width and shape, and visually read various information.

Motor Coordination:
Requires the ability to coordinate hands and eyes rapidly and accurately in using automated office equipment and communications machinery.

Manual Dexterity:
Requires the ability to handle a variety of items including computer keyboards, office equipment, control knobs, switches, etc.  Must have minimal levels of eye/hand/foot coordination.
 
Color Discrimination:
Requires the ability to differentiate between colors and shades of color.

Interpersonal Temperament:
Requires the ability to deal with people beyond giving and receiving instructions.  Must be adaptable to performing under minimal levels of stress when confronted with an emergency or tight deadline.

Physical Communication:
Requires the ability to talk and/or hear (talking: expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken words; hearing: perceiving nature of sounds by ear).  Must be able to hear and understand communications through a telephone.

Performance Evaluation Criteria

Is knowledgeable in the methods, policies and procedures of the District pertaining to specific duties of the Library Assistant.  Is knowledgeable in the laws, ordinances, standards and regulations pertaining to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position.  Has thorough knowledge of the organization of the department and of related departments and agencies. Description:
Join the IPG Team!
Are you ready to elevate your career? At IPG, we are more than just a global leader in packaging and protective solutions-we are a community that values safety, people, passion, integrity, performance, and teamwork. From tapes and films to packaging and protective products, as well as engineered coated materials and advanced packaging machinery, we develop innovative solutions that protect the world. Now, we are expanding our global team and looking for talented individuals like you!

Position Purpose
The primary purpose of the Lead Maintenance Specialist is to provide guidance to the maintenance team in keeping the facilities and equipment running safety and efficiently; promote continuous improvement by providing supplies, equipment, parts, and overall coordination of tasks within the maintenance department. Lead by influencing the maintenance team to achieve excellence in equipment uptime.
The Lead Maintenance Specialist will maintain personal compliance with IPG's Safety and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and will actively communicate the provisions of the Code to assure broad support and understanding of the program.

Principle Accountabilities
Assist engineering and maintenance teams with projects, equipment installations, repairs, and modifications. Lead some projects with minimum oversite from engineering.
Oversee and maintain maintenance management database systems to ensure accurate tracking of maintenance labor hours, on-time PM completion and inventory management. Maintain work order database (input work orders, track and identify trends and areas for improvement). Responsible for daily work order entering.
Coordinate and assist with the sourcing and purchasing of maintenance and facilities equipment and supplies. This includes securing replacement parts for obsolete and stock items, working with vendors to ensure they are a viable supplier from a pricing, availability, and quality standpoint.
Plan and assign daily maintenance activities with safety as the primary target.
Coach and train maintenance team to ensure skills meet levels required to support the operations. Provide input to Maintenance Manager on team skills and performance.
Plan and administer the preventative and predictive maintenance schedules for the maintenance department to ensure activities are completed timely and accurately as required. This includes opening, assigning, and closing of all weekly, monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, and annual preventative maintenance work orders.
Serve as backup to ISO Coordinator for the department which includes various ISO duties (maintaining work instructions, validating calibration logs, updating procedures, internal audits).
Support and promote safe working practices within the facility.
Support the continuous improvement activities of the organization by participating in and coordinating action plans for plant-wide improvement activities or projects. Also provides reports, information and data to various departments as requested for projects and/or problem-solving.
Related tasks as requested by supervisor.

Essential Skills and Experience
Minimum associate degree and three to five years industrial maintenance experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite
Must have excellent communication and organizational skills.
Demonstrated leadership skills.
Must be organized and able to handle multiple projects, and possess an understanding of the manufacturing maintenance responsibilities of entire facility
Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Must be detail oriented and conscientious
Effective communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to work with cross-functional teams

Physical Effort
Must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Also, must be able to climb ladders and
perform work at heights above floor level.

Working Environment
Manufacturing environment exposure which requires use of appropriate personal protective equipment.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They
are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of the incumbent in this position.

Why Choose IPG?
At IPG, you will find more than just a job-you will find a place where your success is our success. We pride ourselves on a culture built around strong relationships, where every team member plays a crucial role in our growth. Whether it is through cross-department collaboration, continuous training, or sustainability-driven initiatives, we create an environment where you can thrive.
Our commitment to sustainability influences everything we do, from designing eco-friendly products to minimizing waste in our production processes. We are dedicated to building a greener future while providing safe, supportive workplaces for our people.
With over 40 years of industry expertise and a proven track record of growth and innovation, IPG offers a stable, secure environment where you can flourish!
We offer competitive pay, extensive benefits that support you and your family, and exciting career development opportunities. Whether you are looking to enhance your skills or advance your career, we offer ongoing training and the support you need to succeed. Think big, dream bigger, and make an impact with IPG.
You belong here. Join us today!
