Description:
Professional Solutions Delivered, LLC (ProSoDel) is a total solutions provider for government and commercial customers in the areas of Program Management, Logistics, Organizational Change Management, Communications, Training, and Information Technology (IT) Support Services. We are currently seeking an Oracle Database Specialist to join our team of professionals in support of the Oracle/Linux Opportunity located at Hill Air Force Base, Utah. This position is not remote and requires in-person attendance Monday – Friday.Essential Duties & Job Functions:
Responsible for performing database and application regression testing on ~75 databases and ~25-30 applications.
Responsible for implementing DISA STIGs for ~100 Oracle Enterprise 8 instances.
Design and implement complex database architectures for high availability and performance.
Assess and develop long-term strategic goals for production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers.
Install and configure new Oracle Database instances.
Plan and execute upgrades and migrations.
Monitor database performance, identifying bottlenecks and implementing improvements.
Tune SQL queries and database parameters to optimize performance.
Define and implement robust backup and recovery procedures.
Perform and automate regular backups, recoveries, and data refreshes as required.
Implement and maintain database security policies and procedures.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements for data safety and privacy.
Manage schema changes, data migration, and transformation scripts.
Ensure data integrity and quality across the database systems.
Provide expert troubleshooting for complex database issues.
Offer technical support and guidance to development teams.
Analyze and predict future database resource requirements.
Scale database operations to meet growing business needs.
Develop and maintain scripts to automate common database administration tasks.
Document the database setup, architecture, and any changes applied.
Maintain updated documentation for the data models and dictionary.
Provide expertise and training to junior database administrators and other technical staff.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions and workshops.
Collaborate with IT project managers and business analysts on project planning, delivery, and execution.
Communicate effectively with the Program Manager to ensure database capabilities and potential issues are made known.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Oracle technologies and best practices.
Evaluate and recommend new database technologies, tools, and features.
Performs related work, as assigned.
Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations)
Mandatory
Education:
Bachelor’s degree or higher.
Must have LINUX+ from CompTIA.
Certification:
Possess an active DoD Approved 8570 IAT Level II or above Certification.
Experience: 5-8 years
Minimum of 3-5 years LINUX and/or Oracle Database Administration Experience.
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience working in a customer facing environment.
Ability to monitor and optimize database and server performance, including troubleshooting and resolving performance issues.
Ability to implement and maintain database security measures, including access controls, encryption, and data masking.
Familiarity with DISA STIGs, NIST SP800-53.x requirements, and experience in conducting DoD vulnerability/compliance assessments.
Clearance: US citizen with active DoD Secret (T3) clearance
Preferred
CYSA+/CISSP preferred.
Title: Oracle Database Specialist

Description:
Summary
 Why should you join the BlueCross BlueShield of South Carolina family of companies?

Other companies come and go, but we've been part of the national landscape for more than seven decades, with our roots firmly embedded in the South Carolina community. We are the largest insurance company in South Carolina ... and much more. We are one of the nation's leading administrators of government contracts. We operate one of the most sophisticated data processing centers in the Southeast. We also have a diverse family of subsidiary companies, allowing us to build on various business strengths. We deliver outstanding service to our customers. If you are dedicated to the same philosophy, consider joining our team!

Position Purpose:

Drawing on extensive knowledge of goods and services, legal terms and business requirements, responsible for preparing/generating contract language/documents for vendors and service providers by ensuring all terms and conditions within the contracts meet business requirements and contain all required approvals and signatures.
Description
 Logistics:
This position is located ONSITE at our Pipeline Building location at 105 New Way Road Columbia, SC 29223. This position is full time, 40 hours per week/8 hours per day, Monday-Friday.
What You'll Do:
Drafts goods and services related contractual agreements: obtains from and prepares contract documents for goods and services vendors and/or subcontractors and consultants.
Conducts initial review of agreements, prepares redlines and consults with internal/external legal counsel.
Consults with internal buyers/clients regarding purpose, timetable, and cost.
Problem solving: receives goods and services contract related inquiries, researches contract related issues, provides suggested solutions, convenes and manages the ad hoc teams to resolve the problem.
Generates contracts ranging in value from tens of thousands to millions of dollars for management and Law Department final approval.
Negotiations: Controls the goods and services agreement negotiations process, secures attorneys and technical experts, leads the negotiation sessions, ensures redlines are produced in a timeframe consistent with deadlines. Resolves roadblocks and facilitates mutual agreement.
Reporting: Stores partially and fully negotiated agreements in database and on Law Dept. network. Provides monthly reports to management.
Coordinates with Corporate Law personnel regarding throughput of the legal review process.
May conduct Request for Proposal (RFP) training and prepare and maintain template documents for the RFP process.
May conduct training on purchasing policies and contract administration.
Closure: Obtains final signatures on agreements from authorized personnel. Ensures that final agreements are properly matched with purchase requisitions and purchase orders.
To Qualify for This Position, You'll Need the Following:
Required Education: Bachelor's degree
Required Work Experience: 3 years contract administration experience
Degree Equivalency: 4 years job related work experience or Associate's and 2 years job related work experience
Required Skills and Abilities:
Acts as liaison with other areas
Analyzes information
Conducts audits
Drafts contracts
Leads negotiates sessions.
Required Software and Tools: Microsoft Office skills
We Prefer That You Have the Following:
Strong Excel
Our comprehensive benefits package includes the following:
We offer our employees great benefits and rewards. You will be eligible to participate in the benefits the first of the month following 28 days of employment.
Subsidized health plans, dental and vision coverage
401k retirement savings plan with company match
Life Insurance
Paid Time Off (PTO)
On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in major locations
Education Assistance
Service Recognition
National discounts to movies, theaters, zoos, theme parks and more
What We Can Do for You:
We understand the value of a diverse and inclusive workplace and strive to be an employer where employees across all spectrums have the opportunity to develop their skills, advance their careers and contribute their unique abilities to the growth of our company.
What to Expect Next:
After submitting your application, our recruiting team members will review your resume to ensure you meet the qualifications. This may include a brief telephone interview or email communication with our recruiter to verify resume specifics and salary requirements.
Management will be conducting interviews with those candidates who are the most qualified, with prioritization given to those candidates who demonstrate the required qualifications.

The state of South Carolina offers eligible employees generous benefits, including health and dental insurance; retirement and savings plan options; and paid vacation and sick leave. Retirement Benefits

Utilize solid working knowledge of networks, servers and desktop applications with the ability to multitask while monitoring and working through issues on both phone calls and emails. Microsoft Technology Associate (MTA) IT Infrastructure certification; OR
2 years of experience in Computer, Windows Active Directory, network, and IT hardware support in an enterprise or multi-site IT environment
Ability and knowledge to perform primary steady-state administration, monitoring of enterprise management systems, maintaining systems, troubleshooting issues, correcting problems, installing system security patches, patch management, hardware and software upgrades, data storage, data retrieval, backup job creation, backup job modification, backup job verification, data replication, system optimizations, updating documentation, and providing research assistance for problem resolution involving configuration issues or other conflicts.
Knowledge and experience supporting steady-state, enterprise-wide SCCM deployments.
Experience and knowledge monitoring, supporting and utilizing enterprise management applications and tools such as, but not limited to HP SIM, SolarWinds, CommVault, vCenter, NICE Vision Control Net, EVOIP Nagios monitoring, SCCM, SCSM, SCOM, Splunk, Cisco PRIME, Dell OpenManage Essentials, customized SharePoint sites.
Knowledge, expertise, and technical proficiencies providing steady-state support for an enterprise-wide Microsoft Active Directory infrastructure. Thorough understanding of enterprise-level server software including the latest Microsoft Server technologies to include associated hardware and software.
Ability to manage and perform enterprise-wide upgrades and changes systematically and regularly.
Ability to monitor systems for potential problems and resolve issues promptly.
Ability to monitor systems and activities to ensure compliance with enterprise-wide standards. Ability to manage AD/DC components, such as DNS, Organizational Units, AD Sites and subnets, GPOs, ACLs, accounts/passwords, create accounts, disable accounts, delete accounts, add DC Groups, and perform system backup/recovery operations.
Ability and knowledge to perform secondary administration providing steady-state monitoring of systems, access control, hardware installations, wiring/cabling support, equipment rack re-locations, power source support, backup media rotations, etc. This assistance could also include installations/upgrades, OS configurations, problem resolution, and system administration or recovery with the direct guidance of the remote staff.
Knowledge and experience in supporting steady-state systems Backup, Restore, and Recovery procedures.
Clearance:
Must be able to obtain a Secret clearance.

Description:
Distribution Supervisor - Onsite -(3rd Shift)

Working Hours: 3pm-11pm Mon-Fri

Fort Mill, SC, United States

Come make the world and accelerate your success.

It takes great people to achieve greatness. People with a sense of purpose and integrity. People with a relentless pursuit of excellence. People who care about making things better For Those Who Make The World™. Sound like you? Join our top-notch team of more than 50,000 diverse and high-performing professionals globally who are making their mark on some of the world's most beloved brands, including DEWALT®, BLACK+DECKER®, CRAFTSMAN®, STANLEY®, CUB CADET®, and HUSTLER®.

The Job
As a Distribution Supervisor, you'll be part of our Tools & Outdoor Global Supply team located in Fort Mill, SC. You'll get to:
Ensure safety of employees via active safety culture management, policy enforcement, and assisting in developing improvements to our business
Maintain a personnel structure and staffing level to accomplish the department's mission in an effective and efficient manner
Plans and coordinates work by performing time studies, cost analysis, or other means as necessary
Trains and motivates; monitors and evaluates performance of associates in the department
Ensures associates ability to safely operate material handling equipment to move materials to and from storage configurations
Team member engagement. Effectively build relationships and trust with the team in order to successfully execute daily/weekly/monthly goals.
Develops Team Leaders to effectively oversee the daily routines of their assigned associates
Monitors, measures, and documents department performance for cost, labor, and productivity requirements
Working with the Human Resources Department, select employees through the normal hiring process, consistently administer policies and procedures as applicable, monitor employee performance/attendance/time, resolve associate relation issues, coach and counsel for improvement and apply discipline consistently where necessary up to and including termination of employment.


The Person

You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You're not intimidated by innovation. Wouldn't it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? In fact, you embrace it. You also have:
Bachelor's Degree Preferred
Minimum 5+ years' experience in a warehouse, distribution, or manufacturing setting. Minimum 1+ years' recent relevant leadership experience as well as proficiency in Microsoft Office to include Excel, Word, and Outlook.
Experience with inventory or warehouse software, databases, and other systems including SAP and WMS, preferred.
Proven track record of change management (driving, influencing and inspiring change through communication).
Regularly required to stand, walk, reach, and use hands. May occasionally be required to kneel, crouch, stoop, lift and/or 10lbs regularly up to 50lbs. occasionally.


The Details

You'll receive a competitive salary and a great benefits plan, including:
Medical, dental, life, vision, disability, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan, paid time off, and tuition reimbursement in addition to programs & benefits in support of your well-being.
Discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and other partner programs.


And More:

We want our company to be a place you'll want to be - and stay. Being part of our team means you'll get to:
Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.
Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our digital learning portal.
Belong: Experience an awesome place to work, where we have mutual respect and a great appreciation for a wide range of perspectives and experiences.
Give Back: Help us continue to make positive changes locally and globally through volunteerism, giving back, and sustainable business practices.


What's more, you'll get that pride that comes from empowering makers, doers, protectors, and everyday heroes all over the world. We're more than the #1 tools company. More than a driving force in outdoor power equipment. More than a global leader in industrial. We're visionaries and innovators. As successful as we've been in the past, we have so much further to go. That's where you come in. Join us!

#LI-AT1

#LI-Onsite

We Don't Just Build The World, We Build Innovative Technology Too.

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means working in an innovative, tech-driven and highly collaborative team environment supported by over 58,000 professionals in 60 countries across the globe. Here, you'll get the unique chance to impact some of the world's most iconic brands including STANLEY TOOLS, DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, MAC TOOLS and Black + Decker. Your ideas and solutions have the potential to reach millions of customers as we work together to write the next chapter in our history. Come build with us and take your career to new heights.

Who We Are

We're the World's largest tool company. We're industry visionaries. We're solving problems and advancing the manufacturing trade through innovative technology and our Industry 4.0 Initiative. We are committed to ensuring our state-of-the-art "smart factory" products and services provide greater quality to our customers & greater environmental and social value to our planet. We are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company.

Benefits & Perks

You'll get a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, life, vision, wellness program, disability, retirement benefits, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, including paid vacation, holidays & personal days, and tuition reimbursement. And, of course, discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and products and well as discount programs for many other vendors and partners.

What You'll Also Get

Career Opportunity: Career paths aren't linear here. Being part of our global company with 60+ brands gives you the chance to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.

Learning & Development:
Our lifelong learning philosophy means you'll have access to a wealth of state-of-the-art learning resources, including our Lean Academy and online university (where you can get certificates and specializations from renowned colleges and universities).

Diverse & Inclusive Culture:
We pride ourselves on being an awesome place to work. We respect and embrace differences because that's how the best work gets done. You'll find we like to have fun here, too.

Purpose-Driven Company:
You'll help us continue to make positive changes in the local communities where we work and live as well as in the broader world through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.

EEO Statement:
All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status or any other protected characteristic.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete an application or access our website, please contact us at (860) 827-3923 or at accommodations@sbdinc.com. Due to volume, we cannot respond to unrelated inquiries about the status of a completed application or resetting an account password.

Know Your Rights: Workplace discrimination is illegal (eeoc.gov)

POSITION OVERVIEW AND PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS):

Red Peak Technical Services, LLC a subsidiary of Alutiiq, LLC has an opportunity for a Sr. Systems Engineer. The Sr. Systems Engineer will provide system analysis of components or subsystems of Naval military systems. Candidate will perform engineering work and apply judgment to resolve conflicting requirements.
Vehicle barrier assessments to determine systems engineering decisions, including COTS vs. OEM parts, form/fit/function replacements, system design, fabrication design and systems engineering.
Review current asset tagging strategy to determine the best approach to stocking COTS vs. OEM parts.
Evaluates asset inventory, conducts cost-benefit analysis and conducts 80/20 analysis to determine program spend and cost-savings measures.
Ability to draft test requirements, test plans, and test reports.
Ability to perform system simulation.
Working knowledge of fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of automation and control systems.
Familiarity with current computer applications and technologies in mechanical, electrical, and controls engineering.
Ability to solve complex technical design and development problems that require a professional level of engineering knowledge.
Ability to solve complex technical problems.
Ability to edit and manipulate CAD drawings.
Requires about 25% travel.

Payrate: $110,000 to $150,000 Annually

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering from an accredited institution plus eight (8) to twelve (12) years relevant specialized experience performing system design, integration, laboratory and shipboard testing, and limited GUI development for mechanical systems development.
Four (4) years experience with Electronic Security Systems
Four (4) years experience in digital and analog systems and subsystems
Four (4) years of experience on U.S. Navy maintenance philosophy
Provide system analysis of components or subsystems of Naval military systems.
Perform engineering work and apply judgment to resolve conflicting requirements.
Experience with Lenel, Physical Security Systems, Access Control Systems preferred.
Ability to build and test RF, circular and fiber connectors.
Experience in cable placement and routing in ship and shore environments.
Security Clearance Required: Secret
Pursuant to the Government Contract, you must be a U.S. Citizen.

Description:
Through its wholly owned subsidiaries, American States Utility Services, Inc. contracts with the federal government to provide water and wastewater services that include operating, maintaining, renewing, replacing, and constructing new systems on military installations throughout the United States. The installations where we presently operate are home to nearly 350,000 military and civilian personnel and families.

We proudly deliver these vital services to military installations in Maryland, North Carolina, South Carolina, Texas (including southeastern New Mexico), Virginia, Florida, Kansas, and Massachusetts.

Serving those who serve.

United States Veterans, Reservists, National Guard Members, and Military Spouses encouraged to apply.

POSITION DEFINITION: The incumbent in this position is responsible for supervising the Company's Environmental Health and Safety Programs. This includes, monitoring federal, state, and local environmental, water quality, and public water supply regulations and legislation, and assisting the Engineering and Construction teams in compliance with these regulations.

ACCOUNTABILITY:
As a skilled employee and responsible professional, the incumbent must work independently, exercise initiative and judgment in the performance of a broad range of responsibilities in an environment of routinely sensitive and confidential issues. Therefore, the employee must have strong organizational and interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all levels of the company's management staff, visitors, and vendors.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:
• Supervises assigned EH&S Program Administrators, assigns daily tasks, and reviews their timekeeping
• Oversees and monitors the maintenance of relevant compliance documentation to ensure accurate and timely record-keeping for proactive management purposes and to meet regulatory guidelines for documentation and reporting
• Prepares/updates environmental policies, procedures and guidelines for Manager approval to ensure compliance with applicable regulations
• Prepares environmental responses and reports that reflect the best interests of the Company and its customers
• Initiates, coordinates, and participates in environmental audits. Prepares environmental assessments of Company Capital projects. Recommend actions to reduce potential environmental hazards
• Coordinates training in the areas of technical expertise, water and wastewater certifications, injury risk reduction, OSHA regulations and compliance with safe practices
• Oversees all environmental and health department permits, including public water supply, erosion control, and landfill permits
• Tracks Company's Capital project permit process to review for accuracy in application, monitoring program, and close-out procedures
• Interprets and recommends actions to comply with applicable environmental federal, state, and local laws and regulations
• Coordinates Company's safety programs, including Illness and Injury Prevention Programs, Safety Audits, OSHA requirements, MSDS documentation, and training programs
• Analyzes proposed legislation, environmental impact reports, environmental documents and environmental, water quality, and public water supply regulations that may impact the Company. Consults with internal and external contacts to provide technical expertise and information needed to effectively guide and enable others to comply with applicable policies, rules, regulations, and laws
• Oversees development of safety policies, procedures and guidelines for Officer approval to ensure compliance with applicable regulations
• Interprets and recommends actions to comply with applicable federal, state and local safety laws and regulations. Assists in preparation of required safety records and related documents
• Collaborates with Company personnel and Company consultants in assisting in the development and maintenance of the Company's safety and security program
• Develops and supervises the training and other programs for employees to ensure that relevant information and procedures related to environmental health risks are effectively disseminated to management, supervisors, and all other employees
• Assists Engineering and Construction teams with Renewal & Replacement Projects, Capital Upgrade Projects, and the regulatory requirements associated with the projects
• Works closely with the Capital Construction Manager on all environmental, health and safety items related to construction activities
• Identifies potential environmental and/or health hazards to Company employees, Company facilities, and the public to minimize the Company's liability
• Conducts data analysis, summarizes data with tables and graphs, and prepares reports and/or presentations to explain causes and effects on water quality as required by management
• Maintains the Company's Databases that may include but are not limited to ASUS AWWIMS, Water Quality, Cross-connection Control, and Employee Training
• Performs periodic field inspections, office walk-throughs, and plant inspections. Completes safety inspection reports, including recommending actions for correction
• Serves as the Company's representative on environmental committees, both internally and externally
• Serves as the Company's representative on safety committees, both internally and externally
• Coordinates upcoming organic construction activities with individual subsidiary environmental health & safety coordinators to facilitate safety checks and reviews
• Oversees Company research activities related to environmental issues. Prepares and implements studies to improve overall environmental issues. Prepares and implements studies to improve overall environmental quality control. Prepares technical reports and documents in support of any research or study
• Other related duties as required

MINIMUM POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
• A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, or other related sciences or related field; Master's degree highly desirable
• Five years' environmental engineering, regulations and water and wastewater operations experience with demonstrated increasing responsibilities performing highly complex work
• Three to five years' experience in supervising technical staff
• Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Requires State mandated certification or ability to obtain certification
• Must have and maintain a valid Driver's License for the state in which employed

The incumbent must be willing to travel as required by project needs.

Qualities / Core Competencies:
• Trustworthy, strong personal integrity.
• Demonstrates a strong level of accountability and ownership.
• Solid interpersonal skills
• Executes with discipline and urgency.
• Demonstrated impact and influencing skills.
• Good written and verbal communication skills.
• Collaborative team oriented.
• Exhibits professionalism with internal and external contacts.
• Organized with strong attention to detail and time management skills
• Data analysis skills including ability to use advance features of Excel (pivot tables, graphs, charts).
• High degree of initiative, self-motivated.

The above job description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all responsibilities, skills or competencies associated with this job.

May include but not limited to standing, climbing, walking, lifting, bending, pulling and/or pushing, grasping, reaching, stooping and crouching, sitting, typing, walking, reading, writing, color determination, speaking and listening for extended periods of time.

BENEFITS

Our Company supports our employees with rich benefit programs and resources to help them thrive today and prepare for tomorrow. Benefit options include medical, dental, and vision plans with the Company currently paying 85% of the monthly premium for employees and their eligible dependents. We also offer paid vacation and sick time and twelve Company paid holidays per year. To help our employees plan for the future, we offer both a 401(k) retirement plan as well as a Defined Contribution Profit Sharing retirement plan. Additional benefits include life, AD&D, and LTD insurance as well as health savings account and flexible spending plans.

COMPENSATION INFORMATION

The compensation range provided is in compliance with state specific laws. Multiple factors are used to determine the actual starting rate of pay for all of our positions, including specific skills, years of experience, education, certification(s), and other job related factors.

U.S. Citizenship is required pursuant to our contract with the federal government.

The responsibilities of this position will involve access to information that may be considered confidential, private and sensitive. Therefore, the individual filling this position will be required to both allow and pass a background check.

NOTE: Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with special needs to perform the essential functions.

Additional Comments
The Technical College of the Lowcountry seeks to be the first choice for higher education in South Carolina's Low Country Region. The college is a public, open door, two-year comprehensive College of higher education. The College is dedicated to serving the diverse educational, workforce development, and personal enrichment needs of the rural counties of Beaufort, Colleton, Hampton, and Jasper. In an atmosphere of shared values, the College encourages creativity, innovation, and resourcefulness among its students, faculty, staff, and administrators. South Carolina is making our Veterans a priority for employment in state agencies and institutions.
The Technical College of the Lowcountry is committed to a policy of equal opportunity for all qualified applicants for admissions or employment without regard to sex, race/color, religion, national origin, age, disability, service in the uniformed services (as defined by state and federal law), veteran status, political affiliation or belief, marital or family status, pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions, including but not limited to, lactation, genetic information, genetic identity, gender expression, or sexual orientation.
Benefits for State Employees
The state of South Carolina offers eligible employees generous benefits, including health and dental insurance; retirement and savings plan options; and paid vacation and sick leave. Plus, work-life balance programs such as telecommuting and flexible work schedules are available to employees of some state agencies.

Insurance Benefits
Eligible employees may enroll in health insurance, which includes prescription coverage and wellness benefits. Other available insurance benefits include dental, vision, term life insurance, long term disability and flexible spending accounts for health and child care expenses.

Retirement Benefits
State employees are also offered retirement plan options, including defined benefit and defined contribution plans. Additionally, eligible employees may elect to participate in the South Carolina Deferred Compensation Program, which is a voluntary, supplemental retirement savings plan offering 401(k) and 457 plan options.

Workplace Benefits
State employees may also be eligible for other benefits, including tuition assistance; holiday, annual and sick leave; and discounts on purchases, travel and more.

Note: The benefits above are available to most state employees, with the exception of those in temporary positions. Employees in temporary grant and time-limited positions may be eligible for all, some or none of these benefits as benefits are associated with each position type. For these positions, contact the hiring agency to determine what benefits may be available.

A minimum of 2-3 years of development experience is preferred, along with proficiency in Blackbaud's Raiser's Edge, NXT, or similar prospect management systems. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who is ambitious, goal-oriented, and capable of working within a complex, multi-faceted organization to establish philanthropic and productivity goals, create actionable plans, and achieve objectives. Strong leadership, interpersonal, and written/verbal communication skills are essential. The ability to build excellent relationships with all constituents and to develop and monitor budgets, as assigned.
The ideal candidate will preferably reside within one of the Regional Health Network markets to effectively build relationships and support the local community.

Job Duties

30% - Works collaboratively with RHN leadership, the Senior Director of Development of Regional Health Network, the Associate Dean for Medical Development, and other key MUSC Health and Institutional leaders to design and oversee comprehensive fundraising strategies. Ensures effectiveness across all phases of the major gift cycle, including donor identification, cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship. Advises leadership and colleagues on development strategy, assisting in setting priorities to achieve sustained private support for the Regional Health Network.

30% - Manages a portfolio of constituents, which may include corporate or foundation donors, patients, families, community members, and alumni prospects to advance development priorities of the RHN, MUSC Health, and the MUSC enterprise. Develops strategies for each major prospect and conducts regular outreach. Meets established goals (e.g. dollars raised, solicitations, visits, etc.). Enters actions into database and keeps solicitations up to date.

20% - Serves as a key liaison among Institutional and Advancement leaders, including the MUSC Foundation, Advancement Services, Communications, Annual Giving, Principal Giving, and Corporate and Foundation Relations, to ensure seamless coordination of resources and strategies in support of fundraising goals. Supports donor, RHN needs through cross-departmental alignment and operational excellence. As needed, under the supervision of the Senior Director of Development RHN, may assist in managing advisory boards approved by the institution and the Associate Dean for Medical Development, fostering engagement and advancing the Regional Health Network's objectives.

15% - Proactively identifies, cultivates, and stewards relationships with prospective and existing donors to generate significant private support. Collaborates closely with clinicians, MUSC Health leadership, and Institutional Advancement colleagues to create and execute specific, high-impact gift opportunities. Plays a key role in implementing tailored solicitation strategies for individual donors, ensuring alignment with broader Regional Health Network priorities.

5% - Other duties as assigned.
Additional Job Description
The Ideal candidate for this position should be located in the PeeDee or Columbia areas.
Education: Bachelors Degree or equivalent Work Experience: 8-10 years
If you like working with energetic enthusiastic individuals, you will enjoy your career with us!

Cloud technologies. Develop, enhance, maintain, and support cloud-based server and application initiatives.
Administer and manage our Azure cloud environment, including virtual machines, network configurations, and security settings.

Description
The Systems Administrator will work with the Joint Threat Warning System-Air (JTWS-AIR) team administering, integrating and configuring tools onto Windows Servers and workstations to support United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM). Main duties include providing updates for Microsoft patches and tools from various repositories, installing and updating the applications, and configuring each to successfully run on the system. The candidate will have to network servers together in a software lab environment and work on potentially multiple systems and builds to be kept up to date and ready for on-time deployment/delivery. The candidate selected will be working in a team environment to produce new builds to the IV&V group, and will have to support any changes or make any fixes found by the testing group. The Systems Administrator will be supporting quarterly and semi-annual update process working closely with an Information Assurance team to address vulnerabilities. The Systems Administrator will participate in the execution of the monthly build process and provide supporting documentation for information to support documentation including: trouble tickets/bug reports, Software Change Requests (SCR), input to the System Version Document (SVD), and any build plans and installation procedures. This process includes the installation of GOTS and COTS software, troubleshooting, and extensive information systems security analysis and the controls implemented to secure a system.
Performing SYSADMIN duties on assigned government-authorized systems
Assisting security managers with developing ISS documentation (SSP, CMP, CP, RMP, etc.) to support the Assessment & Authorization (A&A) of assigned systems
Performing ISS controls assessments as part of the systems' Continuous Monitoring Plan
Overseeing configuration management of assigned systems, Working knowledge of contemporary imaging solutions (Symantec Ghost, Macrium Reflect, etc) and Windows licensing implementations (MAK, KMS, TBA)
Performing periodic software inventory assessments; asset and media management support, Familiarity with formatting and packaging of audit logs and data in order to submit them for external review
Performing technical security assessments of computing environments to identify vulnerabilities and security control deficiencies, familiarity with ACAS or the equivalent Tenable products (Nessus, Security Center, etc) required to make these assessments
Assisting security managers with developing POA&Ms, and remediating control deficiencies, assisting with ISS Self Assessments when required
Applying system patches and manage vulnerabilities as required
Analyzing, designing, testing, documenting, implementing and supporting of DoD Systems and network technologies
Working knowledge of Cisco Routers, applications, and technologies such as Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Cisco VLANs, and IIS.
Preparing and maintaining up to date documentation detailing configuration of deployed solutions
Demonstrating proficiency with the design, provisioning and troubleshooting of LAN/WAN connectivity technologies
Building test and staging environments that accurately mirror production environments.
Evaluating new and emerging security threats, products and technologies
Understanding of Public Key Infrastructure and encryption
Developing and evaluating customer computing programs and operations to determine adherence to policies and procedures mandated by governing agencies

Description:
Inspire health. Serve with compassion. Be the difference.
Job Summary
Responsible for overseeing the Office of Philanthropy's financial management and database integrity activities. Executes and maintains effective financial policies and appropriate accounting controls, compliance with gift agreements, reporting from Treasury and Accounting to ensure proper handling and recording of financial activity, monitoring budgetary expenditures and philanthropy database Financial Edge general ledger. Ensures integrity of philanthropy database, designs and executes fundraising and financial reports, and collaborates with fund administrators and managers to financial records. Works with multiple sources of funding which may include state/federal, restricted, endowed, grant and contract funds.
Essential Functions
All team members are expected to be knowledgeable and compliant with Prisma Health's values: Inspire health. Serve with compassion. Be the difference.
Meets monthly reconciliation and financial close deadlines with accuracy, preparing and submitting journal entries and reports to Accounting.
Monitors expenditures, fund allocations and related financial activities for the purpose of ensuring accurate forecasting, revenue projections and expenses are within budget limits and/or fiscal practices.
Ensures timely and accurate processing of all payments, including vendor invoices, individual reimbursements, and other accounts payable and receivables, research discrepancies.
Oversees creation of both endowed and non-endowed funds following all necessary steps to ensure consistency and compliance with requirements set forth by internal audit, working in collaboration with philanthropy team members, Accounting and Treasury; creates associated fund descriptions and accounts.
Creates and distributes more than 120 individualized monthly reports to various fund managers, department chairs, administrators, etc.
Initiates introductory meetings with new fund managers who are unfamiliar with philanthropy to educate on processes, reporting and timelines, and use of funds.
Monitors philanthropy funds to ensure that funds are used are aligned with donor intent/fund purpose and identifies and advises on how to resolve underutilized funds.
Collaborates with Treasury and Accounting to identify and resolve funds within miscellaneous revenue. This helps all involved by decreasing the need to reclass revenue after month end.
Validates and submits endowment spend to Treasury and financial summaries to Manager of Donor Relations annually for mandatory annual endowment reporting to donors.
Oversees all aspects of gift entry in philanthropy database and conducts daily and monthly reconciliation to ensure accuracy and integrity.
Manages integration of data to/from other systems with philanthropy database.
Develops business rules to meet needs of the Foundation and ensures ability to meet compliance, data security and reporting requirements.
Processes gifts and supplemental information in philanthropy database; enters biographical and other relevant information for prospects and donors, including individuals, businesses, foundations, family foundations, and organizations.
Designs and executes fundraising and financial reports as needed for Foundation and responds to team members' inquiries and requests regarding fundraising database and reporting capabilities.
Develops coding hierarchies for giving campaigns, appeals, volunteers, events, etc. to enable accurate reporting and analysis
Provides onboarding & database training to new Foundation team members.
Assesses current reporting protocols and makes improvements
Performs other duties as assigned.
Supervisory/Management Responsibilities
This is a non-management job that will report to a supervisor, manager, director or executive.
Minimum Requirements
Education - Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field of study.
Experience - Five (5) years of accounting and/or finance
In Lieu Of
In Lieu of the education and experience requirements noted above, the following combination of education, training and/or experience may be considered an equivalent substitution: Associate degree and eight (8) years of experience in accounting, finance, philanthropy, database administration/management or combination of above.
Required Certifications, Registrations, Licenses
NA
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Experience using Blackbaud Raiser's Edge and Financial Edge Software.
Competency in using the suite of Microsoft Office programs and a relational database.
Ability to handle confidential information in appropriate manner. Experience with Blackbaud products preferred.
Strong organizational skills and ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and communicating progress regularly.
Resourcefulness, flexibility, and tenacity to meet individual and team goals.
Ability to work effectively in a large, complex, and dynamic organization and adapt to change.
Knowledge of office equipment (fax/copier)
Proficient computer skills (word processing, spreadsheets, database)
Data entry skills
Mathematical skills

Day (United States of America)

Prisma Health Corporate Office

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of SQL Server, SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), and familiarity with rental management systems like Rental Man (WYNND) . The candidate will be responsible for managing and supporting a complex SQL Server environment with 180 SQL instances and multiple SQL clusters. The Senior SQL Developer will also work on troubleshooting, triaging, and resolving issues related to SQL, APIs, and interconnected applications.
Key Responsibilities:
SQL Server Management & Optimization:
Maintain and optimize 180+ SQL Server instances, ensuring high performance and reliability.
Manage several SQL Server clusters, ensuring they are properly configured, scalable, and high availability.
Perform database performance tuning, query optimization, and index management to ensure optimal performance across all instances.
Design, implement, and monitor backups, disaster recovery, and high availability solutions.
ETL Development & SSIS:
Develop, deploy, and maintain complex SSIS packages for ETL processes to ensure data is efficiently integrated from various sources into SQL Server databases.
Troubleshoot and optimize SSIS packages to improve performance and reduce processing time.
Ensure SSIS processes are executed on schedule and meet operational requirements.
Troubleshooting & Support:
Provide troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for performance issues, SQL errors, and system outages in SQL databases and applications.
Analyze and resolve issues with interconnected applications and APIs that interact with the SQL Server databases.
Work with stakeholders across teams to investigate and resolve system performance and data integrity issues.
API and Interconnected Systems Management:
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to API integration with SQL databases and other internal systems.
Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless communication between SQL databases and interconnected applications.
Ensure APIs are performant and are correctly integrated with the backend SQL architecture.
Collaboration & Documentation:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software development, network administration, and business analysts, to design and implement solutions.
Provide mentorship and guidance to junior SQL developers, sharing best practices for development, troubleshooting, and system optimization.
Maintain clear and thorough documentation of SQL server configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
Rental Man (WYNND) Integration:
Develop and maintain integrations between SQL Server and Rental Man (WYNND), ensuring seamless data exchange and system reliability.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues specific to the Rental Man system and its SQL database integrations.
Required Qualifications:
Experience:
5+ years of experience in SQL Server development and administration, including working with SQL Server instances, clusters, and performance tuning.
Hands-on experience with SSIS for building ETL processes and integration workflows.
Extensive experience troubleshooting and triaging issues across SQL databases, APIs, and interconnected applications.
Knowledge of Rental Man (WYNND) or similar rental management systems is highly preferred.
Technical Skills:
Strong proficiency in T-SQL for querying, stored procedures, triggers, and script development.
Familiarity with SQL Server Clustering and high availability solutions (Always On Availability Groups, Failover Clustering, etc.).
Expertise in API integration with backend SQL databases.
Strong knowledge of performance tuning, indexing strategies, and query optimization.
Proficiency in PowerShell or other scripting languages for automation and administrative tasks.
Experience with database security best practices (e.g., encryption, user access control).
Soft Skills:
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications: Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate or Microsoft Certified: SQL Server Database Administrator certifications are a plus.
Experience: Familiarity with cloud-based database services (e.g., Azure SQL, Amazon RDS) would be advantageous.

POSITION SUMMARY
The primary responsibilities of the Safety Manager are to ensure that all safety training and compliance expectations are being met at the Georgetown Plant.  The Safety Manager is responsible for compliance with OSHA regulations at the plant.  This position is responsible for maintaining safe and healthy working conditions at all times.  This position ensures that all staff safety needs are met in a timely fashion.  The Safety Manager is responsible for the administration of and adherence to company and plant safety policies.  This position is to proactively ensure that the plant staff is properly trained to complete the required tasks in a safe manner.  The Safety Manager will conduct themself in a professional manor at all times, treating all employees with dignity and respect, and acting as a role model and mentor for all employees under their direct or indirect supervision.  The Safety Manager is to keep the Plant Manager informed of any significant safety issues or changes in policies or regulations.
REGULAR DUTIES
Develop and maintain an effective and well-organized safety program that involves all employees. 
Ensure the safety program meets all requirements of OSHA and American Gypsum. 
Administer and coordinate safety policies with other plants and corporate office as needed. 
Ensures personnel practices follow applicable laws and regulations.
Assists managers in hazard resolution as necessary. 
Maintain employee safety training records.
Enter, interpret, and utilize safety data in the online company safety database to proactively improve plant safety and reduce incident rates.
Network with safety counterparts at other plants to work through relatable issues and implement best practices.
Track and communicate safety trends and suggestions via safety reporting software. 
Conduct safety committee meetings, inspections, and audits of all plant facilities and processes to ensure safe operations.
Maintain the written safety program for OSHA compliance and ensures all aspects of the written safety program are being followed. 
Maintain a current online Safety Data Sheets (SDS) library on all products in the plant. 
Plan, coordinate, and conduct effective monthly safety meetings for the plant, including creating and updating training materials to keep employees engaged.
Complete new hire safety orientation with each new employee and follow up regularly with new hires after orientation to make sure they understand plant safety practices. 
Properly document and file all the plant safety activities.
Attend department safety huddles weekly and spend significant time on the floor observing employee operations and discussing safety with the employees.
Assist with the investigation and diagnosis of plant accidents and/or safety issues.
Recommend courses of action to the appropriate department head and implement appropriate and approved corrective measures, and follow-up to ensure completion.
Be available for transport of injured employees to clinic and or hospitable during plant operations as needed. 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Working knowledge of OSHA safety regulations.
Ability to make presentations and conduct training sessions for all levels of plant and corporate personnel.
Strong communications skills and a professional demeanor.
Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Must be able to work in an environment with minimal supervision.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Perform professionally with a positive attitude while working in a team environment.
Exercise sound judgment within assigned responsibilities.
Manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Present a professional and personable image with a positive attitude.
Self-motivated to complete all tasks as assigned, on schedule and in a professional manner.
Ability to identify problems within the position and implement practical solutions in a timely manner so that the problems do not reoccur. 
Physically capable of climbing stairs.
Proficient verbal and written skills.
Must be available for callouts, including during night shift.
Must be able to sit or stand for prolonged periods of time. 
Must have manual dexterity needed to type on a computer keyboard.
Continued hand/wrist motion is required to operate computer and office machinery.
Must be able to read papers and reports without assistance.
Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license.
Occasional travel in a personal or company vehicle is required.
Occasional overnight travel may be required.
Must be able to stand and/or walk for extended periods of time
Occasional lifting of up to 25 pounds.
GEORGETOWN PLANT SPECIFIC DUTIES
Audit insurance of all vendors and contractors.
Conduct and document all onsite contractor safety training.
Hold monthly supervisor safety meetings to refresh plant trainers before they train their respective crews.
Attend safety meetings in each department at least weekly to identify areas of excellence and opportunities to improve safety.
Maintain plant provided CPR/AED and first aid training certifications.
Plan and execute audits and testing including hearing, industrial hygiene, and others as needed.
WORKING CONDITIONS
Work is performed mainly in the manufacturing plant and plant office.
Normal work hours are Monday through Friday, 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM or similar if approved by the Plant Manager. 
Additional hours are required as necessary.
Must be available for call-ins to assist with safety or personnel issues.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Microsoft Dynamics 365 Administrator will be responsible for the effective management, administration, maintenance, and scalability of our Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain Management (F&SCM) environments. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with internal teams to ensure seamless operation, user access, security, and performance of the application.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
User Management and Access Control: Continuously review and optimize role-based authorizations within Dynamics 365 environments to ensure secure and efficient system usage.
System Monitoring and Maintenance: Proactively monitor Dynamics 365 environments to identify and resolve performance issues, ensuring optimal system performance, availability, and reliability.
Release and Change Management: Stay up-to-date with upcoming releases and fixes for Dynamics 365, assessing their impact on the environment and coordinating the implementation of release and change management processes.
Administration: Serve as the primary point of contact for the entire application including security coordination of APIs and ISVs, license utilization and projected needs, and analyzing and modifying the system configuration to include testing and debugging in response to support tickets.
Integration Support: Work with external vendors to troubleshoot issues and resolve performance problems with ISVs.
Documentation and Knowledge Management: Document key processes, system designs, knowledge articles, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) related to Dynamics 365 administration, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
Maintenance Notifications: Monitor and communicate scheduled maintenance notifications to internal teams and clients, minimizing disruptions to business operations.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, analysts, and business stakeholders, to address system requirements and improve user experiences. Work with business SMEs to ensure proper workflows and training documentation.

SKILLS
Active Listening - Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Speaking - Talking to others to convey information effectively and speaking up when mistakes are made or answers/information is needed.
Critical Thinking - Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Communication - Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Positive attitude with desire to learn and grow with the company.


REQUIREMENTS: EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION
Proven experience as a Microsoft Dynamics AX Administrator, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Administrator, or similar role (2 years preferred).
In-depth understanding of Microsoft Dynamics applications, architecture, and modules.
Experienced in Microsoft Dynamics configuration, batch processing, and workflow design.
Proficiency in user management, access control, and permissions allocation within Microsoft Dynamics environments.
Strong knowledge of supporting release and change management processes.
Microsoft Dynamics performance monitoring, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis.
Excellent documentation and knowledge management skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant certifications in Microsoft Dynamics administration or related areas are a plus.
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and paid time off. Cameron Ashley is an equal opportunity employer. Employment with the Company is always at-will.

* This description reflects the assignment of essential functions. It does not proscribe or restrict tasks that may be assigned.

Encompass Administrator/Configurator (Hybrid - Columbia, SC)

The primary function of the Encompass Administrator/Configurator is to ensure the seamless operation and optimal performance of Encompass systems. This role involves managing system configurations, providing technical support, and maintaining comprehensive documentation. The Administrator/Configurator collaborates with various departments to understand their needs, implements system changes, and conducts training sessions to enhance user proficiency. Additionally, the role focuses on continuous improvement and business analysis to optimize processes and support business objectives.

What you'll do
- System Administration: Manage and maintain Encompass systems, ensuring they are up-to-date and functioning correctly.
- Perform System Analysis: Simulation testing to determine the potential impact of deploying proposed system changes.
- Technical Support: Provide technical support to users, troubleshooting and resolving issues promptly.
- Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures.
- Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and implement system changes that support business objectives.
- Training: Conduct training sessions for users to ensure they are proficient in using the systems.
- Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for system improvements and work with the IT team to implement enhancements.
- Business Analysis: Conduct business analysis to gather requirements, optimize processes, and ensure effective system configurations.

What you'll need
- Bachelor's degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field
- Minimum of 3 years of Ellie Mae Administration experience in system administration, configuration, and testing.
- Proficiency in configuring Milestones and Persona, building Input forms, reports, dashboards, and advanced coding of business rules.
- Experience in ensuring adherence to governance standards, managing risks, and maintaining compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
- Encompass Administrator Certification, preferred
- Proficiency in system administration and configuration tools
- Knowledge of the financial services industry
- Ability to conduct business analysis to gather requirements and optimize processes.
- Commitment to identifying and implementing opportunities for system and process enhancements.
- Experience preferred in Visual Basic, SDK, APIs, .Net, and Azure Dev Ops
Title: Encompass Administrator/Configurator

We are seeking a full time Systems Administrator to join our IT organization at our Corporate Headquarters in Duncan, SC.  After gaining knowledge of our environment, there is the opportunity for this position to work under our Hybrid schedule working both in the office and remotely.  
The Systems Administrator will support and maintain global IT infrastructure, including Azure cloud infrastructure, VMware, Citrix, and Active Directory. Ensures the reliability and performance of IT systems while addressing technical issues, optimizing system performance, supporting business operations, and maintaining tickets through ServiceNow, with strong troubleshooting skills to identify, analyze, and resolve complex technical problems efficiently.
Responsibilities
Manage and maintain servers, operating systems, and storage solutions in an on-premises and Azure, AWS cloud environments.
Troubleshoot and resolve server, software, and storage issues, escalating to senior team members or vendors as needed.
Respond to help desk tickets and user support requests, providing resolutions for technical problems.
Perform routine system updates, patches, and backups.
Monitor system performance and maintain infrastructure health to prevent downtime.
Participate in small to medium-scale infrastructure projects and execute assigned tasks.
Document standard operating procedures, processes, and system configurations.
Ensure compliance with established IT policies, procedures, and security guidelines.
Assist in the configuration and maintenance of Active Directory, Microsoft 365, and virtual environments (e.g., VMware and Hyper-V).
Qualifications
Associates degree preferred
5 or more years in Information technology
Working knowledge of Microsoft, VMware, Networking, and Security
Independent-thinker and self-starter, who can work within a team environment
Be detail-oriented and produce good documentation
Excellent written and verbal communication
Enjoy working with cross-functional teams and vendors.
Experience as a team lead
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws. 
Technical Skills:
Proficient in Microsoft server and client operating systems (Server OS: 2012R2-Current; Client OS: Windows 7 - Current)
Active Directory infrastructure and dependent services
Azure Active Directory:  AD Connect, SSO, MFA
Microsoft M365/EMS Suite
Azure Cloud Services
SAN and NAS technologies and concepts, NetApp experience preferred
VMware:  ESX and vCenter
Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops (On-Premise and Cloud)
Solid understanding of:
Networking concepts and protocols in an enterprise environment
Data protection concepts and software in an enterprise environment
Scripting:  Powershell, VBscript, and bat 
Personal Qualities
Analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
Exceptional customer focus and customer service approach.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills.
Ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms
Dedication to continually update knowledge.
Logical and efficient.
Keen attention to detail.
Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.
Highly self- motivated and directed.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Working Conditions
Some travel required; less than 25%
Some evening and weekend work required
Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.

Description:
Join Our Team!

Sunbelt Rentals strives to be the customer's first choice in the equipment rental industry. From pumps to scaffolding to general construction tools, we aim to be the only call needed to outfit a job site with the proper equipment. Not only do we offer a vast fleet that ranks among the best in the industry, we pair it all with a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our employees are our greatest asset, and although we present a comprehensive equipment offering, our expertise and service are what truly distinguish us from the competition.

We pride ourselves on investing in our workforce and offer competitive benefits, as well as extensive on-the-job training for all eligible employees.

As a highly successful national company, we are constantly looking for talented individuals to support our growth. If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career, we invite you to review our opportunities!

Job Description Summary

Position Objective:

The Sr. ServiceNow Developer will be responsible for the configuration and acceptable customization of the Sunbelt Rentals platform. The developer will assist in requirements gathering, innovative designs, configuring and customizing (when necessary) the ServiceNow platform to support Sunbelt Rentals internal and external workflows. The ideal candidate is a seasoned ServiceNow Developer who can work closely with the ServiceNow administrators, process owners and other technology teams to implement a stable and performant baseline platform. The ServiceNow Developer will also need a strong ability to multi-task between growth projects, maintenance projects, and assist in resolving current open issues.

Position Responsibilities:

Responsible for the development and integration of the Sunbelt platform with external partners to drive operational automation and efficiency
Lead the development of business process integrations into our ServiceNow instance, including ITBM, GRC, HR Delivery, CSM, and ITSM
Lead the coordination, design, and execution of integrating standard LDAP & 3rd party apps into the ServiceNow environment.
Implement scripted web services in ServiceNow, jQuery, or Prototype libraries, Java, and CMDB or asset integrations in ServiceNow
Customize workflows, code business rules and UI Scripts using JavaScript to create custom applications and configurations on the ServiceNow platform
Develop scripts and codes for API's and webservice integrations
Configure roles, permissions, business rules, and UI policies for ServiceNow
Complete functional/technical designs and associated estimates to meet defined requirements
Lead development in an Agile methodology
Work with administrators and process owners to solution business process workflows using the baseline ServiceNow configurations
Assist with ServiceNow resources on patching, hotfixes, platform upgrades, platform testing related to new and existing platform capabilities/functionality
Assist with standard daily, weekly, monthly maintenance, and overall system health checks
Assist with routine set updates within the system for all changes made
Maintain design documentation (requirements, design documents, build, deployment, install guides) and process standards along with regular audits to validate accuracy
Stay up to date with the latest releases and product enhancements
Present new product developments to key stakeholders


Requirements:

Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and 5+ years work experience
ServiceNow Developer certification
ITIL v3 certification highly preferred
Ability to develop/configure and enhance core applications including, but not limited to, platform UIs, service portal, mobile app, tables, forms, lists, catalogs, workflows, roles, properties, business rules, ACLs, dashboards, homepages, and reports
Strong ability to design, build and deliver workflows and service catalog items
Strong understanding of CSDM and CMDB, including integrating, importing data using asset discovery tools
Advanced understanding of the use of development, test, and production environments
Expert in update set creation and system cloning
Skilled in developing custom end-user Service Portals through the internal design process
Knowledgeable of customizing email notification templates, SLA definitions, and form fields
Experience in Agile/Scrum development cycle environments

Physical Demands:

Must be able to bend, squat, crouch and/or reach and lift up to 25 pounds or more, as required by the job. Some Sunbelt jobs may require driving for long periods of time, loading and unloading heavy equipment, performing work in extreme weather conditions including rain, wind or excessive temperatures and/or night and weekend work. All duties must be performed according to Sunbelt's safety policies and guidelines. Reasonable accommodations may be made to comply with ADA/ADAAA.

The above description covers the principal duties and responsibilities of the job. The description shall not, however, be construed as a complete listing of all miscellaneous, incidental or similar duties which may be required from day to day.

Sunbelt Rentals is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran and any other protected ground

Base Pay Range: $100,896.00 - 138,732.00

Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. Please visit https://www.sunbeltrentals.com/careers/ for more information on our benefits and to join our Talent Network.

Sunbelt also provides a comprehensive benefits package to its full-time employees. This package includes health, dental and vision plans, 401(k), volunteer time off, short-term and long-term disability, accident, life and travel insurance, as well as flexible spending, tuition reimbursement, college savings, EAP and length of service awards. You will become eligible for benefits on the first of the month following 30 days from your start date. Sunbelt offers team members the following time off from work, subject to Sunbelt's policies: twelve to twenty-five vacation days depending on years of service; five sick days; six paid holidays, two paid half day holidays, two floating holidays, one inclusion day, and one volunteer day (unless specified in a collective bargaining agreement).

Gear up for an exciting career!

Sunbelt Rentals supports service members. Veterans encouraged to apply.

If a current Sunbelt Rentals employee has referred you for an employment opportunity please notify them that you are applying for this position. In order for the employee to get a referral bonus they need to contact their regional recruiter.

:
Education:

Experience:
Seven (7) years with Master's or 11 years with Bachelor's degree of professional experience in systems administration to include supporting daily operational requirements of computer network systems including workstation, file servers, and web servers.
Duties include installation of hardware, software, systems upgrades, network accounts, network security, and web page design, interface and updates, and local system design documentation.
Individual shall have experience maintaining, troubleshooting, and implementing network security tools including firewalls, anti-virus, and intrusion detection services.
Individual shall be capable of training staff on software applicable to their position, assisting customers with information technology, monitoring system configuration (hardware and software), and providing instruction on computers and applications. 
TS/SCI level Clearance required.
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:   
Dependent on task, individual shall meet the latest Cybersecurity workforce certification/training in accordance with DoD 8570.1M and subsequent DoD 8140 manual as applicable. Must have or be able to attain within 30 Days of assignment Information Assurance Technical (IAT) II certification. 
Job Description:
The Systems Administrator administers and supports daily operational requirements of computer network systems including workstation, file servers, and web servers. Duties typically involve the installation of hardware, software, systems upgrades, network accounts, network security, and web page design, interface and updates, and local system design documentation. This administrator will maintain, troubleshoot, and implement network security tools including firewalls, anti-virus, and intrusion detection services. This Administrator trains staff on software applicable to their position, assists customers with information technology, monitors system configuration (hardware and software), and provides instruction on computers and applications. Certifications. Industry standards for certifications change often and should not be codified in position descriptions unless certain certifications are required for the specific position sought by a particular contract AND the certification is not likely to change during the contract development, competition, and award.   
Essential Duties of the Job:
Ability to communicate task requirement information to client in a clear and concise manner.
Must be able to sit and stand for prolonged periods of time, as well as lead and participate in meetings and working groups.
Requires visual acuity to use a keyboard.
Must be able to attend work each day, during scheduled hours, unless on travel or approved time off.
Ability to work on computer for long periods, and communicate with individuals by telephone, email and face-to-face
Physical Demands and Work Environment:
While performing duties of job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hand to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear.
Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
May be exposed to chemicals related to office equipment.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate (i.e. general office environment).

Basic & Supplemental Life Insurance
Short & Long Term Disability Insurance
Flexible Spending Account
11 Paid Holidays
Paid Time Off (PTO)

Description
Vickers and Nolan Enterprises (VNE) is an engineering company that provides Government projects and programs with experienced and dedicated system architects, engineers, subject matter experts (in tactical intelligence), and program managers. VNE also develops training courses and tools to prepare warfighters to effectively employ tactical intelligence systems and provide management guidance to the Government organizations that develop these systems.
VNE has earned a reputation for exceptional performance, innovation, agility, and responsiveness in the Intelligence Community (IC). We attack our mission with a comprehensive understanding of the data available and required; skilled research, design, development, integration, and testing of systems and software solutions; expertise in cybersecurity/information assurance and technology; programmatic, acquisition, and logistics support know-how; and our own unique training curricula that enables students to excel at intelligence operations across all levels of the community.
VNE is devoted to improving tactical operations at home and abroad by enabling the seamless transition of data across the intelligence community and developing/integrating solutions to unify operations and intelligence.
VNE is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) founded in 2004 in Stafford, VA.

Candidates must be capable of multitasking, possess highly refined communication skills and who are capable of presenting information in a variety of forums for the program team to include integrated product team level and above.

SAIC accepts applications on an ongoing basis and there is no deadline.
