Who We Are:
At The Urban Electric Co., we make it our mission to recruit and retain highly skilled and passionate individuals. Because we have a genuine respect for the talents and story of every member of our team, our culture attracts a wide variety of personalities and backgrounds to create an eclectic and fun atmosphere. Each of our company’s products is bench-made and hand-finished at our 180,000 sq. ft. headquarters in Charleston, which houses the talented engineers, sales and marketing professionals, designers, and craftsmen who make up our team. We pride ourselves on manufacturing processes that secure the growth and sustainability of artisanal craft for the future by using modern techniques that enhance and refine the hand-build approach as opposed to replacing it.
Some Benefits & Perks of Working at The Urban Electric Co.:
Opportunity for very generous quarterly bonuses through the company PMB (Productivity Metric Bonus) program
Medical & dental insurance with employer contributions
401(k) savings plan with employer match
Paid parental leave for new moms and dads
Generous paid time off and holidays
A company-wide health & wellness initiative
An on-site barista with complimentary drinks and snacks
Robust training program with room for growth and merit-based advancement
Who You Are:
As a Systems Administrator at UECo, you are an integral part of the organization's IT infrastructure. You have a passion for ensuring system reliability and efficiency, thrive in troubleshooting challenges, and are committed to delivering secure and effective technology solutions. You enjoy working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to maintain and enhance IT systems and processes.
A Day in the Life:
System Maintenance & Support:
Monitor and maintain system performance to ensure high availability and reliability.
Perform regular updates, patches, and monitor backups to optimize security and performance.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues, including urgent after-hours events such as internet outages, vendor support requests, and critical updates.
End User Support:
Manage user accounts, permissions, and access across various systems and applications.
Provide high-touch, white-glove technical support to end-users for hardware, software, and connectivity issues.
Network & Security:
Assist with configuring and managing network infrastructure, including routers, switches, and firewalls.
Implement security measures to protect systems and data from unauthorized access and threats.
Conduct system audits and vulnerability assessments to identify and mitigate risks.
Documentation & Reporting:
Maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting processes.
Prepare and present reports on system performance, incidents, and resolutions.
Collaboration & Learning:
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including the Software Development team, to implement and support new technologies.
Manage projects efficiently, ensuring clear communication and collaboration to meet goals.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices to continuously improve skills and knowledge.
Serve as an escalation point and mentor for IT Specialists while contributing strategic insights to guide the organization’s technology infrastructure.
What Will Set You Up for Success:
A high school diploma or equivalent.
5+ years of experience in IT systems management, including SaaS administration (e.g., MS Admin Center, Meraki), system configuration (server/cloud and end-user), and maintenance.
Expertise in troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and incident response, with a focus on minimizing downtime.
Experience in AWS Cloud Services, O365 administration, and information security.
A talent for solving problems and identifying areas for improvement in processes and systems.
Excellent attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in documentation and system performance.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with a customer-focused mindset.
Ability to manage time effectively and handle multiple ongoing projects simultaneously.
A team-oriented approach with a willingness to adapt and support others to achieve success.
What Will Impress Us:
A Bachelor of Science in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field of study
Advanced knowledge of Windows Server, Mac, Chrome, and Linux operating systems.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell, Python, or Bash.
Familiarity with infrastructure management tools such as Microsoft Admin Center, Cisco Meraki, and Mimecast.
Knowledge of backup strategies, ERP troubleshooting, and project management.
Demonstrated thought leadership in driving solutions and improving IT systems.

Description:
Salary MinSalary MaxOverview
The System Administrator is responsible for managing server, desktop, and domain administration. This role also involves addressing system vulnerabilities, performing periodic disaster recovery tests, and ensuring overall system security and reliability. As a full-time position, it offers a flexible schedule to accommodate tasks that may need to be completed outside of regular business hours.
Responsibilities
Server Administration
Responsible for assuring the maintenance, configuration, testing, and security updates for Windows and Linux based servers both physical and virtual. Will be expected to build hardened configurations based on current NIST standards and to maintain them as vulnerabilities are discovered and standards are updated.
 Desktop Administration
Responsible for assuring the maintenance, configuration, testing, and security updates for Windows and Linux based desktops both physical and virtual. Will be expected to design hardened configurations based on current NIST standards and to maintain them as vulnerabilities are discovered and standards are updated.
 Domain Administration
Responsible for creating and maintaining group policy within Active Directory which adheres to existing policy and standards, domain controller maintenance and updates.
 Vulnerability Management
Monitor for vulnerability and risks within all systems and make recommendations for patching and remediation.
 Disaster Recovery Testing
Perform periodic tests of all critical server failover, backup, and recovery procedures. Document all tests, successes and failures, as well as remediation plans for any failures that occur.
 Backup and Recovery
Confirm the success of nightly server backup processes, verifying and periodically restoring according to a testing schedule.
 VMware Administration
Responsible for maintaining the health and updates of the VMware environment including both virtual desktop and server environments.
 Procedure Manual updates
Update the Information Technology Procedure Manual when procedures change and create new procedures for new processes and systems.
 Inventory
Maintain a current inventory of all desktops and servers.
 All other duties assigned
This position may be called upon to perform other duties not specified above.
Qualifications
Education & Certifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
VMware Certified Professional (VCP) or equivalent experience.
Microsoft Azure Fundamentals, Microsoft 365 Fundamentals, or equivalent experience.
 Professional Experience
Minimum of 5 years' experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator, or similar role.
At least 3 years of hands-on experience with VMware technologies including Horizon, vSphere, and ESXi.
Proven experience maintaining and configuring hybrid Active Directory and Azure environments
Experience leading small teams and projects.
 Technical Skills
In-depth knowledge of VMware vSphere and ESXi, including knowledge of vCenter Server.
Experience in deploying, configuring, and maintaining VMware Horizon View environments.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell and/or Bash for automation tasks.
Demonstrated experience in planning and executing migration, patching, and deployment of Active Directory domains and Azure tenants, including managing migrations, complex deployments, and troubleshooting post-migration issues.
Strong understanding of network architecture, including load-balancing, DNS, network security, and IP networking.
 Systems Knowledge
Familiarity with Windows Server and Linux Operating Systems.
Experience with storage technologies in general, including SAN, NAS, and DAS.
Familiarity with Nutanix storage environments preferred

 Seven (7) years with Master’s or eleven (11) years with Bachelor’s degree of professional experience in systems administration to include supporting daily operational requirements of computer network systems including workstation, file servers, and web servers.

Job Title
Azure SQL Data Architect - Remote
Job Description Summary
As an Azure SQL Data Architect, you'll play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and managing data and information solutions within the Azure platform. Your expertise will span both technical skills and architectural principles, ensuring efficient and secure data management
Job Description
We are seeking an Azure SQL Data Architect, that has significant experience operating effectively in a global organization and managing complex environments. This candidate will also have background in various data platforms. Experience building and continually improving governance processes and tools is a plus.
Key Areas of Responsibility:
Develop and Maintain Azure Data Architecture:
Design and maintain the data architecture, ensuring compliance with data-related policies and standards.
Analyze system integration challenges related to data and propose effective solutions.
Create Roadmaps for modernization of legacy data platforms.
Design, develop, and maintain SQL databases and ensure high levels of data availability.
Write optimized SQL queries for integration with applications and reporting.
Develop, implement, and optimize stored procedures and functions using T-SQL.
Analyze, design, and create database objects (tables, views, indexes, etc.).
Collaborate with software developers, system administrators, and data analysts to meet project requirements.
Design and implement ETL processes to transform and load data between different environments and systems.
Administer and maintain Azure SQL databases, ensuring data integrity, security, and performance tuning.
Manage and monitor database performance and troubleshooting issues.
Automate tasks related to database management using Azure DevOps and other automation tools.
Work with Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, and other data-related services to implement end-to-end data pipelines.
Implement data security best practices in Azure, including data encryption, access management, and backup solutions.
Design and Implement Data Solutions on Azure:
Utilize a range of Azure services, including Azure SQL Database, Data Factory, Data Lake Store, Data Lake Analytics, Stream Analytics, Azure Storage, and Cosmos DB.
Collaborate with data scientists and IT team members to address data-related technical issues and support infrastructure needs.
Data Security and Privacy Protection:
Implement robust security measures to safeguard data.
Ensure compliance with privacy regulations.
Create Data Tools for Analytics:
Build tools to assist data scientists and analysts in optimizing the Azure system.
Foster innovation and industry leadership through effective data solutions.
Strategize for Data Acquisitions and Recovery:
Develop and implement strategies for data acquisition, archive recovery, and database implementation.
Collaborate with Data Governance Teams:
Ensure data solutions align with regulatory requirements.
Work closely with governance teams to maintain compliance.
Monitor System Performance and Troubleshoot Issues:
Keep track of system performance metrics.
Address any issues promptly.
Stay Updated on Azure Platform and Best Practices:
Continuously learn about Azure services and industry best practices.
Qualifications:
Minimum 5 to 7 years of experience in data management and technology.
Proficiency in Azure data services, including Azure SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other related technologies
Proficiency in migration from on-prem legacy SQL to Azure PaaS SQL.
Knowledge of migration technologies for SQL as well as workload migration
Strong experience with Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory, and Azure DevOps.
Hands-on experience with database performance tuning, query optimization, and indexing.
Experience with cloud technologies and deploying databases in Microsoft Azure.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated deployments in Azure environments.
Knowledge of data security principles and practices, especially in cloud environments.
Skills & Personal Qualities:
Strategic mindset: ability to envision end state and the milestone activities to achieve
Excellent written and verbal communication
Analytical and data-driven
Financial acumen
Highly adept at project and change management and story telling
Solution oriented problem solver
Keen attention to detail
Ability to perform under pressure

Bon Secours

Intro paragraph

As a faith-based and patient-focused organization, Bon Secours exists to enhance the health and well-being of all people in mind, body and spirit through exceptional patient care. Success in this goal requires a culture of compassion, collaboration, excellence and respect. Bon Secours seeks people that are committed to our values of compassion, human dignity, integrity, service and stewardship to create an environment where associates want to work and help communities thrive.

Pharmacist- St. Francis Downtown

Job Summary:

The Pharmacist performs medication management activities to ensure safe, rational, and cost-effective therapy while maintaining compliance with all applicable rules, regulations, and standards as promulgated by Federal, State, and accrediting agencies or regulating bodies. The Pharmacist maintains established departmental policies and procedures and complies with department objectives.

Essential Functions:
Process orders and provide medication review for appropriateness, safety and efficacy during order processing and perform any necessary clinical support duties as needed
Ensure accurate preparation of compounded and non-compounded products to include safe handling that is consistent with regulations
Oversee distributive functions of the pharmacy department to facilitate accurate and timely medication availability to patients/staff
Oversee pharmacy technicians and support personnel activities based on department need
Maintain responsibility and accountability for the security of pharmacy inventory based on department need
Identify, document, and resolve potential and actual adverse medication events and may evaluate reports in event reporting system for trending and prevention purposes
Perform medication education to improve patient understanding and adherence consistent with department guidance
Work collaboratively and effectively to communicate verbally and in writing with pharmacy team members, healthcare providers, patients, caregivers, and leaders
Participate in departmental medication safety, quality assurance, drug utilization reviews, drug dosing, infection prevention, student precepting and other activities based on department need


This document is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or working conditions associated with the job. Employees may be required to perform other job-related duties as required by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodation.

Education:

Graduate of an ACPE accredited School of Pharmacy with a BS or PharmD (required)

Advanced pharmacy degree - Doctor of Pharmacy, Masters, Residency (preferred)

Required Licensing & Certifications:

Maintains current license for pharmacist in the state(s) where practicing (required)

Valid state issued ID (required)

BLS Basic Life Support (preferred)

Immunization Certified (preferred)

Experience:

2 years of recent experience in an acute care setting (required)

1 year of leadership experience (preferred)

Experience in field of pharmacy practice (required)

One year of experience in field of pharmacy practice (preferred)

Skills & Abilities:
Monitor patient conditions during treatment
Administer non-intravenous medications
Inform medical professionals regarding patient conditions and care
Record patient medical histories
Budgeting & Financial Acumen
Evaluate employee performance
Analyzing data or information
Scheduling
Attention to detail
Acceptance of authority
Critical thinking
Communication with family members
Teamwork
Conflict resolution
Active listening
Relationship building
Prepare medication products consistent with practice site requirements
Handle hazardous drugs
Knowledge of pharmacy operating systems and automation
Computer knowledge - MS Office, spreadsheets, PowerPoint®, drug databases
Core knowledge of medications, including adverse effects, interactions, proper dosing, monitoring parameters and cost
Regulatory compliance
Develop SMART goals and objectives
Provide medication education
Teamwork
Attention to detail
Critical thinking
Customer service for internal and external customers
Communication
Coaching and mentoring
Organization
Stress management

Training:
EPIC Electronic Health Record (preferred)
Exhibit proficient use of all computer hardware and software (required)

Job Details
Visiting Assistant Professor of Finance

The E. Craig Wall Sr. College of Business Administration at Coastal Carolina University invites applications for a Visiting Assistant Professor of Finance in the Department of Finance and Economics beginning Fall 2025. This is a nine-month appointment for the 2025-2026 academic year.
To be considered, candidates should possess a Ph.D. in finance or hold A.B.D. status from an AACSB-accredited program with a specialization supportive of one or more of the finance degree tracks (banking and consumer finance, corporate finance, or wealth management). The Department of Finance and Economics also values candidates with industry experience and community engagement. Candidates holding professional certifications (CFA®, CFP®, ABA Certifications, etc.) are preferred. The ideal candidate would also have a track record of community engagement that can create value for the department and for student learning experiences.
The teaching load is four courses per academic semester, and may include face-to-face, hybrid, and/or online deliveries. It is expected the individual chosen for this position will possess a commitment to teaching excellence, a commitment to involvement in service to the profession, excellent communication skills, and effective teamwork skills.
Accredited by AACSB International, the Wall College of Business serves more than 3000 graduate and undergraduate students. The college offers undergraduate majors in six disciplines (Accounting, Economics, Finance, Management, Marketing, and Hospitality, Resort and Tourism Management), as well as MBA and MAcc graduate programs. Additional information about the College and the University and its programs can be obtained by accessing the university's web site (http://www.coastal.edu).
The Department of Finance and Economics houses majors in both disciplines. The finance major offers a choice of three concentrations: wealth management; banking and consumer finance; and corporate finance. Capstone courses in all three concentrations make use of simulations with the Student Managed Investment Fund embedded in the wealth management capstone. Enrollment in the finance degree has experienced a significant increase in the recent past and is approaching approximately 600 students. The department also has minors in economics, commercial and investment real estate, and actuarial science and risk management along with a certificate in financial planning (CFP® Board Registered Program). The Wall College of Business has a WRDS platform with access to CRSP, Compustat and access to Datastream to support quality scholarship and teaching.
Coastal Carolina University is a public comprehensive liberal arts institution located in Conway, South Carolina, just nine miles from the Atlantic coastal resort city of Myrtle Beach. Coastal Carolina University enrolls over 10,800 students from 49 states and 55 nations. The University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges to award the baccalaureate and master's degrees of national and/or regional significance in the arts and sciences, business, humanities, education, and health and human services, a specialist degree in instructional technology, and PhD degrees in marine science: coastal and marine systems science and education sciences.
Applicants must submit a letter of application, current curriculum vitae, copies of academic transcripts, and contact information of three references electronically at: Review of application materials will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled.
The University provides equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, national origin, or because an employee or applicant for employment is an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, an Armed Forces service medal veteran, a recently separated veteran, or an active-duty wartime or campaign badge veteran, or other "protected veteran," as defined by law.

Coastal Carolina University is an EO/AA employer.
We offer a complete benefits package to full-time employees including health care, dental, vision, retirement, deferred compensation plans, flexible spending accounts, life insurance, long-term disability, holidays, vacation, and sick leave. To learn more details, visit our benefits page.

Company Description
Armavel is a fast-growing IT consulting firm that has built a culture founded on a values-first philosophy. We are passionate about delivering results that are timely and world class via an environment that has all the ingredients for our people to thrive. With this in mind, we seek out candidates that demonstrate the following characteristics: honesty, humility, hustle, empathy, resilience, and positivity. These attributes are vital to our company’s growth and are our first priority in our hiring decisions.
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Meet with clients or management to understand data requirements and needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business analysts, to define data requirements and ensure data-driven decision-making.
Create and maintain data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing data from various sources.
Design and manage data lake houses to support analytical and reporting needs.
Create and maintain data models that align with business requirements and facilitate efficient data retrieval.
Analyze and interpret large and complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Develop and implement machine learning models for predictive analytics and forecasting.
Implement data quality checks and validation procedures to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Implement and monitor data security measures to protect sensitive information.
Maintain detailed documentation for data engineering processes and best practices.
Work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions accordingly.
Continuously monitor and improve data infrastructure to ensure efficiency and scalability
Develop best practice, processes, and standards for effectively carrying out data strategy activities
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and guidelines for all migrated data.
Administer and optimize databases for performance, scalability, and security.
Required Qualifications:
5 years of IT experience
Talend Certified
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology or other engineering or technical discipline (or 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education)
Familiarity with data fabric/ETL tools like Talend
Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration tools like Apache NiFi or Apache Airflow
Understanding of data modeling and data architecture best practices.
Familiarity with event driven and microservices architectures.
Experience with AWS cloud offerings (S3, Redshift, Lake Formation etc)
Experience with data warehousing solutions
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Strong knowledge of SQL and database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, or NoSQL databases).
Must be able to achieve a moderate (Tier 2) VA position of trust
Candidates that do not meet the required qualifications will not be considered.
Preferred Qualifications:
2 years experience using Pearl Scripting, ability to write and reverse engineer scripts, to rewrite using SQL.
Familiarity with client specific solution components, such as Defense Medical Logistics Standard Solution (DMLSS), Military Health Services (MHS) GENESIS, LogiCole, Cerner Millennium and/or InterSystems (HealthConnect/IRIS/HealthShare)
Automated Engineering Management System/Medical Equipment Reporting System (AEMS/MERS), Equipment/Turn-In Request (EQUIP), Maximo Enterprise Asset and Work Management System (EAWM), Point of Use Family of Systems (PoU FoS), Real Time Location Systems (RTLS), and Strategic Equipment Planning Guide (SEPG)/Enterprise Equipment Request (EER) experience a plus
Experience working in the Federal Government, Veteran's Administration (VA) experience a plus
Active clearance for Public Trust Position
